"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote print("=== ACCESSING ARCHIVED WIKIPEDIA PAGE: CARL NEBEL (AUGUST 2023) ===") print("Objective: Retrieve archived version "keyword">and extract first citation reference link\n") # Create workspace directory workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\n") # Define the target page "keyword">and date url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel" archive_date = "20230831" # End of August 2023 print(f"Target URL: {url}") print(f"Target date: August 31, 2023 ({archive_date})\n") # Check "keyword">if archived version "keyword">is available "keyword">in Wayback Machine print("=== CHECKING WAYBACK MACHINE AVAILABILITY ===") api_url = f"https://archive.org/wayback/available?url={url}&timestamp={archive_date}" headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } "keyword">try: print(f"Checking availability: {api_url}") avail_response = requests.get(api_url, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if avail_response.status_code == 200: avail_data = avail_response.json() print(f"API Response status: {avail_response.status_code}") print(f"Response data keys: {list(avail_data.keys()) "keyword">if avail_data "keyword">else &#x27;No data'}") "keyword">if "archived_snapshots" "keyword">in avail_data "keyword">and "closest" "keyword">in avail_data["archived_snapshots"]: closest = avail_data["archived_snapshots"]["closest"] print(f"Closest snapshot found: {closest.get(&#x27;available', 'Unknown status')}") "keyword">if closest.get("available"): archive_url = closest["url"] archive_timestamp = closest["timestamp"] # 2025-08-11 06:16:45

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
# Continue "keyword">from previous step - retrieve the archived page "keyword">and extract citation links "keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== CONTINUING CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ARCHIVE EXTRACTION ===") print("Objective: Retrieve archived page content "keyword">and extract first citation reference link\n") # Use the workspace directory "keyword">from previous execution workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] # Use the most recent one print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # Archive URL found "keyword">in previous step archive_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel" archive_timestamp = "20230306063201" formatted_date = "2023-03-06 06:32:01" print(f"\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}") print(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}\n") # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Retrieve the archived page print("=== RETRIEVING ARCHIVED PAGE CONTENT ===") print(f"Fetching: {archive_url}") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully retrieved archived page") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") print(f"Content type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to retrieve archived page: HTTP {response.status_code}") print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}") exit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error retrieving archived page: {str(e)}") exit() # Parse the HTML content print(f"\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title_element "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find the main content area (avoiding Wayback Machine navigation) main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: # Alternative selectors "keyword">for content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: print("‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not find main content div, using entire body") main_content = soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract all citation reference links print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS ===") # Look "keyword">for citation links - these typically appear "keyword">as [1], [2], etc. "keyword">and link to references citation_links = [] reference_links = [] # Method 1: Look "keyword">for citation links (superscript links "keyword">with numbers) "keyword">for sup "keyword">in main_content.find_all(&#x27;sup', class_='reference'): link = sup.find(&#x27;a') "keyword">if link "keyword">and link.get(&#x27;href'): citation_links.append({ &#x27;citation_number': sup.get_text().strip(), &#x27;href': link.get('href'), &#x27;full_element': str(sup), &#x27;type': 'citation_reference' }) print(f"Found {len(citation_links)} citation reference links") # Method 2: Look "keyword">for reference section links references_section = main_content.find(&#x27;span', {'id': 'References'}) "keyword">or main_content.find('h2', string=re.compile(r'References', re.I)) "keyword">if references_section: print("Found References section") # Find the references list (usually an ordered list after the References heading) references_parent = references_section.find_parent() "keyword">if references_parent: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;ol', class_='references') "keyword">if "keyword">not ref_list: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;div', class_='reflist') "keyword">if "keyword">not ref_list: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;ol') "keyword">if ref_list: print(f"Found references list: {ref_list.name}") "keyword">for i, ref_item "keyword">in enumerate(ref_list.find_all(&#x27;li'), 1): # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in each reference external_links = ref_item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) "keyword">for link "keyword">in external_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): reference_links.append({ &#x27;reference_number': i, &#x27;url': href, &#x27;link_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;full_reference': ref_item.get_text().strip()[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(ref_item.get_text().strip()) > 200 "keyword">else ref_item.get_text().strip(), &#x27;type': 'reference_external_link' }) "keyword">break # Only take the first external link "keyword">from each reference "keyword">else: print("References section "keyword">not found, searching "keyword">for reference links "keyword">in other ways") print(f"Found {len(reference_links)} reference external links") # Method 3: Look "keyword">for any external links that might be citations all_external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): # Skip Wayback Machine links "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: all_external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;link_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;type': 'external_link' }) print(f"Found {len(all_external_links)} total external links") # Identify the first citation reference link print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ===") first_citation = "keyword">None first_reference_link = "keyword">None # Priority 1: First citation reference link "keyword">if citation_links: first_citation = citation_links[0] print(f"First citation reference found: {first_citation[&#x27;citation_number']}") print(f"Citation href: {first_citation[&#x27;href']}") print(f"Citation element: {first_citation[&#x27;full_element']}") # Try to resolve the citation link to the actual reference citation_href = first_citation[&#x27;href'] "keyword">if citation_href.startswith(&#x27;#'): # This "keyword">is an internal anchor link to a reference anchor_id = citation_href[1:] # Remove the # print(f"Looking "keyword">for anchor "keyword">with ID: {anchor_id}") # Find the referenced element referenced_element = main_content.find(id=anchor_id) "keyword">if referenced_element: print(f"Found referenced element: {referenced_element.name}") # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in this reference ref_external_links = referenced_element.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) "keyword">for link "keyword">in ref_external_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: first_reference_link = { &#x27;citation_number': first_citation['citation_number'], &#x27;citation_href': citation_href, &#x27;reference_url': href, &#x27;reference_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;full_reference': referenced_element.get_text().strip()[:300] + '...' "keyword">if len(referenced_element.get_text().strip()) > 300 "keyword">else referenced_element.get_text().strip() } "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f"Could "keyword">not find referenced element "keyword">with ID: {anchor_id}") # Priority 2: First reference external link "keyword">if citation resolution failed "keyword">if "keyword">not first_reference_link "keyword">and reference_links: first_reference_link = reference_links[0] print(f"Using first reference external link "keyword">as fallback") # Priority 3: First external link "keyword">if no references found "keyword">if "keyword">not first_reference_link "keyword">and all_external_links: first_reference_link = all_external_links[0] first_reference_link[&#x27;type'] = 'fallback_external_link' print(f"Using first external link "keyword">as fallback") # Display results print(f"\n=== FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS ===") "keyword">if first_reference_link: print(f"‚úÖ First citation reference link identified!") print(f"Type: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;type', 'citation_reference')}") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_number' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Citation number: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_number']}") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_href' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Citation href: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_href']}") reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') print(f"Reference URL: {reference_url}") reference_text = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '') print(f"Reference text: {reference_text}") "keyword">if &#x27;full_reference' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Full reference: {first_reference_link[&#x27;full_reference'][:200]}...") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No citation reference links found") # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE ===") # Create comprehensive dataset carl_nebel_data = { &#x27;extraction_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel', &#x27;archive_url': archive_url, &#x27;archive_timestamp': archive_timestamp, &#x27;formatted_archive_date': formatted_date, &#x27;page_title': page_title }, &#x27;citation_statistics': { &#x27;total_citation_references': len(citation_links), &#x27;total_reference_external_links': len(reference_links), &#x27;total_external_links': len(all_external_links) }, &#x27;first_citation_reference': first_reference_link, &#x27;all_citation_references': citation_links, &#x27;all_reference_links': reference_links, &#x27;all_external_links': all_external_links[:10] # Limit to first 10 to keep file manageable } # Save main data file data_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json') "keyword">with open(data_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(carl_nebel_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Citation data saved to: {os.path.basename(data_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(data_file):,} bytes") # Save raw HTML "keyword">for reference html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html') "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: {os.path.basename(html_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes") # Create summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;citation_extraction_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"CARL NEBEL - WIKIPEDIA CITATION EXTRACTION SUMMARY\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*55}\n\n") f.write(f"Archive Date: {formatted_date}\n") f.write(f"Source URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\n") f.write(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n\n") f.write(f"CITATION STATISTICS:\n") f.write(f"- Citation references found: {len(citation_links)}\n") f.write(f"- Reference external links: {len(reference_links)}\n") f.write(f"- Total external links: {len(all_external_links)}\n\n") "keyword">if first_reference_link: f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK:\n") f.write(f"- Type: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;type', 'citation_reference')}\n") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_number' "keyword">in first_reference_link: f.write(f"- Citation number: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_number']}\n") reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') f.write(f"- Reference URL: {reference_url}\n") reference_text = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '') f.write(f"- Reference text: {reference_text}\n") "keyword">if &#x27;full_reference' "keyword">in first_reference_link: f.write(f"- Full reference: {first_reference_link[&#x27;full_reference'][:200]}...\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK: Not found\n") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===") "keyword">if first_reference_link: reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: First citation reference link identified!") print(f"üìã Citation URL: {reference_url}") print(f"üìÑ Reference text: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '')}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No citation reference links found "keyword">in the archived page") print(f"üìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Carl Nebel Wikipedia citation extraction completed successfully!")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === CONTINUING CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ARCHIVE EXTRACTION === Objective: Retrieve archived page content and extract first citation reference link Using existing workspace directory: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f Using archive URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel Archive date: 2023-03-06 06:32:01 === RETRIEVING ARCHIVED PAGE CONTENT === Fetching: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel ‚úÖ Successfully retrieved archived page Content length: 90,818 bytes Content type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 === PARSING HTML CONTENT === Page title: Carl Nebel - Wikipedia Main content area identified: div === EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS === Found 9 citation reference links Found References section Found references list: ol Found 3 reference external links Found 0 total external links === IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK === First citation reference found: [1] Citation href: #cite_note-thb-1 Citation element: <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-thb_1-0"><a href="#cite_note-thb-1">[1]</a></sup> Looking for anchor with ID: cite_note-thb-1 Found referenced element: li Using first reference external link as fallback === FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS === ‚úÖ First citation reference link identified! tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:16:45

Execution successful - Code ran without errors and fully completed the **PLAN** requirements. Most importantly, it identified the first citation reference link: citation [1] which points to 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker' with reference text 'Thieme-Becker'. The code found 9 total citation references and successfully resolved the first one to its target URL. üìù Code Python
# Continue "keyword">from previous step - retrieve the archived page "keyword">and extract citation links "keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== CONTINUING CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ARCHIVE EXTRACTION ===") print("Objective: Retrieve archived page content "keyword">and extract first citation reference link\n") # Use the workspace directory "keyword">from previous execution workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] # Use the most recent one print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # Archive URL found "keyword">in previous step archive_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel" archive_timestamp = "20230306063201" formatted_date = "2023-03-06 06:32:01" print(f"\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}") print(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}\n") # Set up headers "keyword">for requests headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Retrieve the archived page print("=== RETRIEVING ARCHIVED PAGE CONTENT ===") print(f"Fetching: {archive_url}") "keyword">try: response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully retrieved archived page") print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes") print(f"Content type: {response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', 'Unknown')}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to retrieve archived page: HTTP {response.status_code}") print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}") exit() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error retrieving archived page: {str(e)}") exit() # Parse the HTML content print(f"\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, &#x27;html.parser') # Get page title title_element = soup.find(&#x27;title') page_title = title_element.get_text().strip() "keyword">if title_element "keyword">else &#x27;Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find the main content area (avoiding Wayback Machine navigation) main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: # Alternative selectors "keyword">for content main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: print("‚ö†Ô∏è Could "keyword">not find main content div, using entire body") main_content = soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract all citation reference links print(f"\n=== EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS ===") # Look "keyword">for citation links - these typically appear "keyword">as [1], [2], etc. "keyword">and link to references citation_links = [] reference_links = [] # Method 1: Look "keyword">for citation links (superscript links "keyword">with numbers) "keyword">for sup "keyword">in main_content.find_all(&#x27;sup', class_='reference'): link = sup.find(&#x27;a') "keyword">if link "keyword">and link.get(&#x27;href'): citation_links.append({ &#x27;citation_number': sup.get_text().strip(), &#x27;href': link.get('href'), &#x27;full_element': str(sup), &#x27;type': 'citation_reference' }) print(f"Found {len(citation_links)} citation reference links") # Method 2: Look "keyword">for reference section links references_section = main_content.find(&#x27;span', {'id': 'References'}) "keyword">or main_content.find('h2', string=re.compile(r'References', re.I)) "keyword">if references_section: print("Found References section") # Find the references list (usually an ordered list after the References heading) references_parent = references_section.find_parent() "keyword">if references_parent: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;ol', class_='references') "keyword">if "keyword">not ref_list: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;div', class_='reflist') "keyword">if "keyword">not ref_list: ref_list = references_parent.find_next(&#x27;ol') "keyword">if ref_list: print(f"Found references list: {ref_list.name}") "keyword">for i, ref_item "keyword">in enumerate(ref_list.find_all(&#x27;li'), 1): # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in each reference external_links = ref_item.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) "keyword">for link "keyword">in external_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): reference_links.append({ &#x27;reference_number': i, &#x27;url': href, &#x27;link_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;full_reference': ref_item.get_text().strip()[:200] + '...' "keyword">if len(ref_item.get_text().strip()) > 200 "keyword">else ref_item.get_text().strip(), &#x27;type': 'reference_external_link' }) "keyword">break # Only take the first external link "keyword">from each reference "keyword">else: print("References section "keyword">not found, searching "keyword">for reference links "keyword">in other ways") print(f"Found {len(reference_links)} reference external links") # Method 3: Look "keyword">for any external links that might be citations all_external_links = [] "keyword">for link "keyword">in main_content.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True): href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): # Skip Wayback Machine links "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: all_external_links.append({ &#x27;url': href, &#x27;link_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;type': 'external_link' }) print(f"Found {len(all_external_links)} total external links") # Identify the first citation reference link print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ===") first_citation = "keyword">None first_reference_link = "keyword">None # Priority 1: First citation reference link "keyword">if citation_links: first_citation = citation_links[0] print(f"First citation reference found: {first_citation[&#x27;citation_number']}") print(f"Citation href: {first_citation[&#x27;href']}") print(f"Citation element: {first_citation[&#x27;full_element']}") # Try to resolve the citation link to the actual reference citation_href = first_citation[&#x27;href'] "keyword">if citation_href.startswith(&#x27;#'): # This "keyword">is an internal anchor link to a reference anchor_id = citation_href[1:] # Remove the # print(f"Looking "keyword">for anchor "keyword">with ID: {anchor_id}") # Find the referenced element referenced_element = main_content.find(id=anchor_id) "keyword">if referenced_element: print(f"Found referenced element: {referenced_element.name}") # Look "keyword">for external links "keyword">in this reference ref_external_links = referenced_element.find_all(&#x27;a', href="keyword">True) "keyword">for link "keyword">in ref_external_links: href = link.get(&#x27;href') "keyword">if href "keyword">and (href.startswith(&#x27;http') "keyword">or href.startswith('https')): "keyword">if &#x27;web.archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href "keyword">and 'archive.org' "keyword">not "keyword">in href: first_reference_link = { &#x27;citation_number': first_citation['citation_number'], &#x27;citation_href': citation_href, &#x27;reference_url': href, &#x27;reference_text': link.get_text().strip(), &#x27;full_reference': referenced_element.get_text().strip()[:300] + '...' "keyword">if len(referenced_element.get_text().strip()) > 300 "keyword">else referenced_element.get_text().strip() } "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f"Could "keyword">not find referenced element "keyword">with ID: {anchor_id}") # Priority 2: First reference external link "keyword">if citation resolution failed "keyword">if "keyword">not first_reference_link "keyword">and reference_links: first_reference_link = reference_links[0] print(f"Using first reference external link "keyword">as fallback") # Priority 3: First external link "keyword">if no references found "keyword">if "keyword">not first_reference_link "keyword">and all_external_links: first_reference_link = all_external_links[0] first_reference_link[&#x27;type'] = 'fallback_external_link' print(f"Using first external link "keyword">as fallback") # Display results print(f"\n=== FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS ===") "keyword">if first_reference_link: print(f"‚úÖ First citation reference link identified!") print(f"Type: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;type', 'citation_reference')}") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_number' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Citation number: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_number']}") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_href' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Citation href: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_href']}") reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') print(f"Reference URL: {reference_url}") reference_text = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '') print(f"Reference text: {reference_text}") "keyword">if &#x27;full_reference' "keyword">in first_reference_link: print(f"Full reference: {first_reference_link[&#x27;full_reference'][:200]}...") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No citation reference links found") # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE ===") # Create comprehensive dataset carl_nebel_data = { &#x27;extraction_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel', &#x27;archive_url': archive_url, &#x27;archive_timestamp': archive_timestamp, &#x27;formatted_archive_date': formatted_date, &#x27;page_title': page_title }, &#x27;citation_statistics': { &#x27;total_citation_references': len(citation_links), &#x27;total_reference_external_links': len(reference_links), &#x27;total_external_links': len(all_external_links) }, &#x27;first_citation_reference': first_reference_link, &#x27;all_citation_references': citation_links, &#x27;all_reference_links': reference_links, &#x27;all_external_links': all_external_links[:10] # Limit to first 10 to keep file manageable } # Save main data file data_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json') "keyword">with open(data_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(carl_nebel_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Citation data saved to: {os.path.basename(data_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(data_file):,} bytes") # Save raw HTML "keyword">for reference html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html') "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: {os.path.basename(html_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes") # Create summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;citation_extraction_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"CARL NEBEL - WIKIPEDIA CITATION EXTRACTION SUMMARY\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*55}\n\n") f.write(f"Archive Date: {formatted_date}\n") f.write(f"Source URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\n") f.write(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n\n") f.write(f"CITATION STATISTICS:\n") f.write(f"- Citation references found: {len(citation_links)}\n") f.write(f"- Reference external links: {len(reference_links)}\n") f.write(f"- Total external links: {len(all_external_links)}\n\n") "keyword">if first_reference_link: f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK:\n") f.write(f"- Type: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;type', 'citation_reference')}\n") "keyword">if &#x27;citation_number' "keyword">in first_reference_link: f.write(f"- Citation number: {first_reference_link[&#x27;citation_number']}\n") reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') f.write(f"- Reference URL: {reference_url}\n") reference_text = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '') f.write(f"- Reference text: {reference_text}\n") "keyword">if &#x27;full_reference' "keyword">in first_reference_link: f.write(f"- Full reference: {first_reference_link[&#x27;full_reference'][:200]}...\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK: Not found\n") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") print(f"\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===") "keyword">if first_reference_link: reference_url = first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_url') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('url') print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: First citation reference link identified!") print(f"üìã Citation URL: {reference_url}") print(f"üìÑ Reference text: {first_reference_link.get(&#x27;reference_text') "keyword">or first_reference_link.get('link_text', '')}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No citation reference links found "keyword">in the archived page") print(f"üìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Carl Nebel Wikipedia citation extraction completed successfully!")

Type: reference_external_link Reference URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker Reference text: Thieme-Becker Full reference: ^ a b Thieme-Becker, entry "Nebel, Carl"... === SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE === ‚úÖ Citation data saved to: carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json File size: 4,106 bytes ‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html File size: 90,818 bytes ‚úÖ Summary report saved to: citation_extraction_summary.txt === EXTRACTION COMPLETE === üéØ SUCCESS: First citation reference link identified! üìã Citation URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker üìÑ Reference text: Thieme-Becker üìÅ All data saved to workspace: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f ‚úÖ Carl Nebel Wikipedia citation extraction completed successfully!
developer Developer History - Plan 01
2025-08-11 06:16:57

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\n\nprint("=== ACCESSING ARCHIVED WIKIPEDIA PAGE: CARL NEBEL (AUGUST 2023) ===")\nprint("Objective: Retrieve archived version and extract first citation reference link\\n")\n\n# Create workspace directory\nworkspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\nprint(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\\n")\n\n# Define the target page and date\nurl = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel"\narchive_date = "20230831" # End of August 2023\n\nprint(f"Target URL: {url}")\nprint(f"Target date: August 31, 2023 ({archive_date})\\n")\n\n# Check if archived version is available in Wayback Machine\nprint("=== CHECKING WAYBACK MACHINE AVAILABILITY ===")\napi_url = f"https://archive.org/wayback/available?url={url}&timestamp={archive_date}"\n\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n}\n\ntry:\n print(f"Checking availability: {api_url}")\n avail_response = requests.get(api_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if avail_response.status_code == 200:\n avail_data = avail_response.json()\n print(f"API Response status: {avail_response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response data keys: {list(avail_data.keys()) if avail_data else \'No data\'}")\n \n if "archived_snapshots" in avail_data and "closest" in avail_data["archived_snapshots"]:\n closest = avail_data["archived_snapshots"]["closest"]\n print(f"Closest snapshot found: {closest.get(\'available\', \'Unknown status\')}")\n \n if closest.get("available"):\n archive_url = closest["url"]\n archive_timestamp = closest["timestamp"]\n \n # Format the timestamp for display\n formatted_date = f"{archive_timestamp[:4]}-{archive_timestamp[4:6]}-{archive_timestamp[6:8]} {archive_timestamp[8:10]}:{archive_timestamp[10:12]}:{archive_timestamp[12:14]}"\n \n print(f"\\n‚úÖ Archive found!")\n print(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}")\n print(f"Archive timestamp: {archive_timestamp}")\n print(f"Formatted date: {formatted_date}")\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ùå No archived version available for {url} on {archive_date}")\n # Try a broader search for August 2023\n print("Trying broader search for August 2023...")\n broader_date = "202308"\n api_url_broader = f"https://archive.org/wayback/available?url={url}&timestamp={broader_date}"\n avail_response_broader = requests.get(api_url_broader, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if avail_response_broader.status_code == 200:\n avail_data_broader = avail_response_broader.json()\n if "archived_snapshots" in avail_data_broader and "closest" in avail_data_broader["archived_snapshots"]:\n closest_broader = avail_data_broader["archived_snapshots"]["closest"]\n if closest_broader.get("available"):\n archive_url = closest_broader["url"]\n archive_timestamp = closest_broader["timestamp"]\n formatted_date = f"{archive_timestamp[:4]}-{archive_timestamp[4:6]}-{archive_timestamp[6:8]} {archive_timestamp[8:10]}:{archive_timestamp[10:12]}:{archive_timestamp[12:14]}"\n print(f"‚úÖ Found broader match: {formatted_date}")\n else:\n print("‚ùå No archived version found for August 2023")\n exit()\n else:\n print("‚ùå No archived snapshots found")\n exit()\n else:\n print("‚ùå Broader search failed")\n exit()\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ùå No archived snapshots found for {url}")\n exit()\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Error checking archive availability: HTTP {avail_response.status_code}")\n exit()\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error accessing Wayback Machine API: {str(e)}")\n exit()\n\nprint(f"\\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}")\nprint(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}")',

"role": 'developer',
"code": '# Continue from previous step - retrieve the archived page and extract citation links\nimport os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\nimport re\n\nprint("=== CONTINUING CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ARCHIVE EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Objective: Retrieve archived page content and extract first citation reference link\\n")\n\n# Use the workspace directory from previous execution\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] # Use the most recent one\n print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# Archive URL found in previous step\narchive_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel"\narchive_timestamp = "20230306063201"\nformatted_date = "2023-03-06 06:32:01"\n\nprint(f"\\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}")\nprint(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}\\n")\n\n# Set up headers for requests\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n}\n\n# Retrieve the archived page\nprint("=== RETRIEVING ARCHIVED PAGE CONTENT ===")\nprint(f"Fetching: {archive_url}")\n\ntry:\n response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=60)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully retrieved archived page")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n print(f"Content type: {response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'Unknown\')}")\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to retrieve archived page: HTTP {response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}")\n exit()\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error retrieving archived page: {str(e)}")\n exit()\n\n# Parse the HTML content\nprint(f"\\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===")\nsoup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n\n# Get page title\ntitle_element = soup.find(\'title\')\npage_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else \'Unknown\'\nprint(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n\n# Find the main content area (avoiding Wayback Machine navigation)\nmain_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\nif not main_content:\n # Alternative selectors for content\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'class\': \'mw-parser-output\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'bodyContent\'})\nif not main_content:\n print("‚ö†Ô∏è Could not find main content div, using entire body")\n main_content = soup\n\nprint(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name if hasattr(main_content, \'name\') else \'Unknown\'}")\n\n# Extract all citation reference links\nprint(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS ===")\n\n# Look for citation links - these typically appear as [1], [2], etc. and link to references\ncitation_links = []\nreference_links = []\n\n# Method 1: Look for citation links (superscript links with numbers)\nfor sup in main_content.find_all(\'sup\', class_=\'reference\'):\n link = sup.find(\'a\')\n if link and link.get(\'href\'):\n citation_links.append({\n \'citation_number\': sup.get_text().strip(),\n \'href\': link.get(\'href\'),\n \'full_element\': str(sup),\n \'type\': \'citation_reference\'\n })\n\nprint(f"Found {len(citation_links)} citation reference links")\n\n# Method 2: Look for reference section links\nreferences_section = main_content.find(\'span\', {\'id\': \'References\'}) or main_content.find(\'h2\', string=re.compile(r\'References\', re.I))\nif references_section:\n print("Found References section")\n # Find the references list (usually an ordered list after the References heading)\n references_parent = references_section.find_parent()\n if references_parent:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'ol\', class_=\'references\')\n if not ref_list:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'div\', class_=\'reflist\')\n if not ref_list:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'ol\')\n \n if ref_list:\n print(f"Found references list: {ref_list.name}")\n for i, ref_item in enumerate(ref_list.find_all(\'li\'), 1):\n # Look for external links in each reference\n external_links = ref_item.find_all(\'a\', href=True)\n for link in external_links:\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n reference_links.append({\n \'reference_number\': i,\n \'url\': href,\n \'link_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'full_reference\': ref_item.get_text().strip()[:200] + \'...\' if len(ref_item.get_text().strip()) > 200 else ref_item.get_text().strip(),\n \'type\': \'reference_external_link\'\n })\n break # Only take the first external link from each reference\nelse:\n print("References section not found, searching for reference links in other ways")\n\nprint(f"Found {len(reference_links)} reference external links")\n\n# Method 3: Look for any external links that might be citations\nall_external_links = []\nfor link in main_content.find_all(\'a\', href=True):\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n # Skip Wayback Machine links\n if \'web.archive.org\' not in href and \'archive.org\' not in href:\n all_external_links.append({\n \'url\': href,\n \'link_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'type\': \'external_link\'\n })\n\nprint(f"Found {len(all_external_links)} total external links")\n\n# Identify the first citation reference link\nprint(f"\\n=== IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ===")\n\nfirst_citation = None\nfirst_reference_link = None\n\n# Priority 1: First citation reference link\nif citation_links:\n first_citation = citation_links[0]\n print(f"First citation reference found: {first_citation[\'citation_number\']}")\n print(f"Citation href: {first_citation[\'href\']}")\n print(f"Citation element: {first_citation[\'full_element\']}")\n \n # Try to resolve the citation link to the actual reference\n citation_href = first_citation[\'href\']\n if citation_href.startswith(\'#\'):\n # This is an internal anchor link to a reference\n anchor_id = citation_href[1:] # Remove the #\n print(f"Looking for anchor with ID: {anchor_id}")\n \n # Find the referenced element\n referenced_element = main_content.find(id=anchor_id)\n if referenced_element:\n print(f"Found referenced element: {referenced_element.name}")\n # Look for external links in this reference\n ref_external_links = referenced_element.find_all(\'a\', href=True)\n for link in ref_external_links:\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n if \'web.archive.org\' not in href and \'archive.org\' not in href:\n first_reference_link = {\n \'citation_number\': first_citation[\'citation_number\'],\n \'citation_href\': citation_href,\n \'reference_url\': href,\n \'reference_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'full_reference\': referenced_element.get_text().strip()[:300] + \'...\' if len(referenced_element.get_text().strip()) > 300 else referenced_element.get_text().strip()\n }\n break\n else:\n print(f"Could not find referenced element with ID: {anchor_id}")\n\n# Priority 2: First reference external link if citation resolution failed\nif not first_reference_link and reference_links:\n first_reference_link = reference_links[0]\n print(f"Using first reference external link as fallback")\n\n# Priority 3: First external link if no references found\nif not first_reference_link and all_external_links:\n first_reference_link = all_external_links[0]\n first_reference_link[\'type\'] = \'fallback_external_link\'\n print(f"Using first external link as fallback")\n\n# Display results\nprint(f"\\n=== FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS ===")\n\nif first_reference_link:\n print(f"‚úÖ First citation reference link identified!")\n print(f"Type: {first_reference_link.get(\'type\', \'citation_reference\')}")\n \n if \'citation_number\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Citation number: {first_reference_link[\'citation_number\']}")\n if \'citation_href\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Citation href: {first_reference_link[\'citation_href\']}")\n \n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or first_reference_link.get(\'url\')\n print(f"Reference URL: {reference_url}")\n \n reference_text = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')\n print(f"Reference text: {reference_text}")\n \n if \'full_reference\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Full reference: {first_reference_link[\'full_reference\'][:200]}...")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ùå No citation reference links found")\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nprint(f"\\n=== SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE ===")\n\n# Create comprehensive dataset\ncarl_nebel_data = {\n \'extraction_metadata\': {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_url\': \'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\',\n \'archive_url\': archive_url,\n \'archive_timestamp\': archive_timestamp,\n \'formatted_archive_date\': formatted_date,\n \'page_title\': page_title\n },\n \'citation_statistics\': {\n \'total_citation_references\': len(citation_links),\n \'total_reference_external_links\': len(reference_links),\n \'total_external_links\': len(all_external_links)\n },\n \'first_citation_reference\': first_reference_link,\n \'all_citation_references\': citation_links,\n \'all_reference_links\': reference_links,\n \'all_external_links\': all_external_links[:10] # Limit to first 10 to keep file manageable\n}\n\n# Save main data file\ndata_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json\')\nwith open(data_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(carl_nebel_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Citation data saved to: {os.path.basename(data_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(data_file):,} bytes")\n\n# Save raw HTML for reference\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html\')\nwith open(html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: {os.path.basename(html_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes")\n\n# Create summary report\nsummary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'citation_extraction_summary.txt\')\nwith open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"CARL NEBEL - WIKIPEDIA CITATION EXTRACTION SUMMARY\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\'*55}\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Archive Date: {formatted_date}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\\n")\n f.write(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"CITATION STATISTICS:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Citation references found: {len(citation_links)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Reference external links: {len(reference_links)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Total external links: {len(all_external_links)}\\n\\n")\n \n if first_reference_link:\n f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Type: {first_reference_link.get(\'type\', \'citation_reference\')}\\n")\n if \'citation_number\' in first_reference_link:\n f.write(f"- Citation number: {first_reference_link[\'citation_number\']}\\n")\n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or first_reference_link.get(\'url\')\n f.write(f"- Reference URL: {reference_url}\\n")\n reference_text = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')\n f.write(f"- Reference text: {reference_text}\\n")\n if \'full_reference\' in report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")\nif first_reference_link:\n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or {first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')}")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No citation reference links found in the archived page")\n\nprint(f"üìÅ All Plan: Follow the first citation reference link from Carl Nebel's Wikipedia page by accessing the URL http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker (the Thieme-Becker biographical dictionary entry). Download and analyze the complete webpage content to locate any images present on the page. For each image found, extract and examine all visible text, dates, numbers, and chronological information to identify the latest (most recent) chronological year date written within any image on that webpage.

Description: This is the necessary next step because: (1) The developer successfully identified the first citation reference link from Carl Nebel's Wikipedia page pointing to the Thieme-Becker entry, (2) We now need to follow this link and access the target webpage to search for images containing chronological year dates, (3) Expected outcome is to locate all images on the Thieme-Becker page and extract the latest chronological year date from any text visible within those images, (4) This directly addresses the TASK requirement to find the latest year date written in images on the webpage reached through the first citation reference link.

Episodic Examples:
### Development Step 8: Locate 1851 atheistic naturalism book on phrenology & mesmerism reissued by publisher in 2009

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify a co-authored book from 1851 that advocated for atheistic naturalism, systematically explored phrenology and mesmerism, was controversial for these topics, and was reissued by a publisher in 2009. Search using keywords including '1851 book atheistic naturalism phrenology mesmerism co-authored', '1851 controversial book phrenology mesmerism reissued 2009', 'atheistic naturalism 1851 publication', and 'phrenology mesmerism 1851 authors'. Focus on identifying both the original 1851 publication details and the specific publisher who reissued it in 2009.

**Use Cases**:
- Academic historian cataloging 19th-century controversial publications by extracting author names, thematic keywords (e.g., ‚Äúatheistic naturalism,‚Äù ‚Äúphrenology‚Äù), and original/reissue dates from archived HTML search results to build a digital bibliography.
- Legal e-discovery team automating the analysis of thousands of saved HTML case summaries to identify specific statutes, publication years, and co-counsel mentions for evidence tracking in litigation.
- Publishing house digital archivist processing legacy website snapshots to pinpoint out-of-print titles, detect reissue editions (e.g., 2009 reprints), and extract publisher credits for planning new annotated volumes.
- Marketing intelligence unit scanning archived competitor webpages to count occurrences of key product terms, track first-release dates, and infer promotional patterns for strategic positioning.
- SEO consultant auditing historical site snapshots to extract keyword density, publication timestamps, and backlink publisher clues from saved HTML to optimize on-page content and refresh outdated pages.
- Compliance officer reviewing stored HTML policy documents to locate regulatory terms, confirm enactment years, and identify issuing bodies for audit readiness and gap analysis.
- Genealogy researcher mining downloaded obituary and local history pages to extract names, vital dates, and relationship mentions for automated family-tree construction.

```
import os
import json
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import re
from collections import Counter

print('=== ANALYZING SAVED HTML SEARCH RESULTS FOR 1851 ATHEISTIC NATURALISM BOOK ===')
print('Objective: Extract information from saved HTML files to identify the book and 2009 publisher\n')

# First, let's inspect what HTML files we have in the workspace
workspace_dir = 'workspace'
html_files = []

if os.path.exists(workspace_dir):
for filename in os.listdir(workspace_dir):
if filename.endswith('.html') and 'search_' in filename:
html_files.append(filename)

print(f'Found {len(html_files)} HTML search result files:')
for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1):
print(f' {i}. {filename}')
else:
print('‚ùå Workspace directory not found')
html_files = []

if not html_files:
print('‚ùå No HTML search result files found to analyze')
print('Need to execute searches first')
else:
print(f'\nüìÅ ANALYZING {len(html_files)} HTML FILES FOR BOOK INFORMATION:')
print('=' * 70)

# Initialize analysis results
analysis_results = {
'timestamp': '2025-01-07',
'files_analyzed': len(html_files),
'book_evidence': [],
'publisher_clues': [],
'author_mentions': [],
'year_confirmations': [],
'topic_confirmations': [],
'reissue_information': []
}

# Analyze each HTML file
for i, filename in enumerate(html_files, 1):
filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, filename)
print(f'\nAnalyzing File {i}: {filename}')
print('-' * 50)

try:
with open(filepath, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
html_content = f.read()

# Parse HTML
soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, 'html.parser')

# Extract all text content
page_text = soup.get_text(separator=' ', strip=True).lower()

print(f'HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters')
print(f'Extracted text size: {len(page_text):,} characters')

# Look for key terms with context
key_terms = {
'martineau': 0,
'atkinson': 0,
'1851': 0,
'letters': 0,
'nature': 0,
'development': 0,
'atheistic': 0,
'naturalism': 0,
'phrenology': 0,
'mesmerism': 0,
'controversial': 0,
'2009': 0,
'reissue': 0,
'publisher': 0,
'edition': 0
}

# Count occurrences of each term
found_terms = []
for term in key_terms.keys():
count = page_text.count(term)
key_terms[term] = count
if count > 0:
found_terms.append(f'{term}({count})')

total_relevance = sum(key_terms.values())
print(f'Total term occurrences: {total_relevance}')
print(f'Found terms: {" ".join(found_terms[:10])}')

# Look for specific patterns and extract context
patterns_found = []

# Pattern 1: Author names together
if 'martineau' in page_text and 'atkinson' in page_text:
# Find sentences with both authors
sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text)
author_sentences = []
for sentence in sentences:
if 'martineau' in sentence and 'atkinson' in sentence:
if len(sentence.strip()) > 10:
author_sentences.append(sentence.strip()[:200])

if author_sentences:
patterns_found.append('Authors mentioned together')
analysis_results['author_mentions'].extend(author_sentences[:3])
print('‚úì Found author mentions together')
for j, sent in enumerate(author_sentences[:2], 1):
print(f' {j}. {sent[:150]}...')

# Pattern 2: Year 1851 with book context
if '1851' in page_text:
sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text)
year_sentences = []
for sentence in sentences:
if '1851' in sentence and any(word in sentence for word in ['book', 'letters', 'work', 'published', 'wrote']):
if len(sentence.strip()) > 10:
year_sentences.append(sentence.strip()[:200])

if year_sentences:
patterns_found.append('1851 with book context')
analysis_results['year_confirmations'].extend(year_sentences[:3])
print('‚úì Found 1851 with book context')
for j, sent in enumerate(year_sentences[:2], 1):
print(f' {j}. {sent[:150]}...')

# Pattern 3: Topic terms (phrenology, mesmerism, naturalism)
topic_terms = ['phrenology', 'mesmerism', 'naturalism', 'atheistic']
topic_mentions = []
for topic in topic_terms:
if topic in page_text:
sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text)
for sentence in sentences:
if topic in sentence and len(sentence.strip()) > 20:
topic_mentions.append(f'{topic}: {sentence.strip()[:150]}')
break # Just get one example per topic

if topic_mentions:
patterns_found.append(f'Topic terms: {", ".join([t.split(":")[0] for t in topic_mentions])}')
analysis_results['topic_confirmations'].extend(topic_mentions)
print('‚úì Found topic terms with context')
for mention in topic_mentions[:2]:
print(f' ‚Ä¢ {mention}...')

# Pattern 4: 2009 reissue information
if '2009' in page_text:
sentences = re.split(r'[.!?]', page_text)
reissue_sentences = []
for sentence in sentences:
if '2009' in sentence:
if any(word in sentence for word in ['reissue', 'reprint', 'edition', 'published', 'publisher', 'press']):
if len(sentence.strip()) > 10:
reissue_sentences.append(sentence.strip()[:250])

if reissue_sentences:
patterns_found.append('2009 reissue information')
analysis_results['reissue_information'].extend(reissue_sentences[:3])
print('‚úì Found 2009 reissue information')
for j, sent in enumerate(reissue_sentences[:2], 1):
print(f' {j}. {sent[:200]}...')

# Look for publisher names near 2009
publishers = [
'cambridge university press', 'oxford university press', 'harvard university press',
'yale university press', 'princeton university press', 'university of chicago press',
'routledge', 'palgrave', 'macmillan', 'sage publications', 'academic press',
'dover publications', 'penguin classics', 'everyman library', 'cambridge', 'oxford',
'norton', 'vintage', 'anchor books', 'university press'
]

found_publishers = []
for pub in publishers:
if pub in page_text:
# Check if publisher appears near 2009
pub_index = page_text.find(pub)
year_index = page_text.find('2009')
if pub_index != -1 and year_index != -1:
distance = abs(pub_index - year_index)
if distance < 500: # Within 500 characters
found_publishers.append((pub, distance))

if found_publishers:
# Sort by proximity to 2009
found_publishers.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])
analysis_results['publisher_clues'].extend([pub[0] for pub in found_publishers])
print('‚úì Found publishers near 2009:')
for pub, dist in found_publishers[:3]:
print(f' ‚Ä¢ {pub} (distance: {dist} chars)')

# Store file analysis
file_analysis = {
'filename': filename,
'total_relevance': total_relevance,
'key_terms': {k: v for k, v in key_terms.items() if v > 0},
'patterns_found': patterns_found
}

analysis_results['book_evidence'].append(file_analysis)

print(f'Patterns found: {len(patterns_found)}')
if patterns_found:
print(f' - {" | ".join(patterns_found)}')

except Exception as e:
print(f'Error analyzing {filename}: {str(e)}')

print('\n' + '=' * 80)
print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SUMMARY')
print('=' * 80)

# Summarize findings
total_author_mentions = len(analysis_results['author_mentions'])
total_year_confirmations = len(analysis_results['year_confirmations'])
total_topic_confirmations = len(analysis_results['topic_confirmations'])
total_reissue_info = len(analysis_results['reissue_information'])
total_publisher_clues = len(analysis_results['publisher_clues'])

print(f'üìä EVIDENCE SUMMARY:')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Author mentions (Martineau + Atkinson): {total_author_mentions}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Year confirmations (1851): {total_year_confirmations}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Topic confirmations: {total_topic_confirmations}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ 2009 reissue information: {total_reissue_info}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Publisher clues: {total_publisher_clues}')

# Analyze publisher frequency
if analysis_results['publisher_clues']:
publisher_counts = Counter(analysis_results['publisher_clues'])
print(f'\nüìö PUBLISHER ANALYSIS:')
print('Most frequently mentioned publishers near 2009:')
for pub, count in publisher_counts.most_common(5):
print(f' ‚Ä¢ {pub}: {count} mentions')

# Identify most likely publisher
top_publisher = publisher_counts.most_common(1)[0]
print(f'\nüéØ MOST LIKELY 2009 PUBLISHER: {top_publisher[0]} ({top_publisher[1]} mentions)')

# Show best evidence examples
if analysis_results['author_mentions']:
print(f'\nüë• BEST AUTHOR EVIDENCE:')
for i, mention in enumerate(analysis_results['author_mentions'][:2], 1):
print(f' {i}. {mention[:200]}...')

if analysis_results['reissue_information']:
print(f'\nüìÖ BEST 2009 REISSUE EVIDENCE:')
for i, info in enumerate(analysis_results['reissue_information'][:2], 1):
print(f' {i}. {info[:250]}...')

# Calculate confidence score
evidence_score = 0
if total_author_mentions > 0: evidence_score += 20
if total_year_confirmations > 0: evidence_score += 20
if total_topic_confirmations > 0: evidence_score += 20
if total_reissue_info > 0: evidence_score += 25
if total_publisher_clues > 0: evidence_score += 15

print(f'\nüìà CONFIDENCE SCORE: {evidence_score}/100')

# Final book identification
print('\n' + '=' * 80)
print('FINAL BOOK IDENTIFICATION')
print('=' * 80)

print('üìñ IDENTIFIED BOOK:')
print(' Title: "Letters on the Laws of Man\'s Nature and Development"')
print(' Authors: Harriet Martineau and Henry George Atkinson')
print(' Original Publication: 1851')
print(' Content: Atheistic naturalism, phrenology, mesmerism')
print(' Controversial: Yes, for its atheistic and pseudoscientific content')

if analysis_results['publisher_clues']:
top_publisher = Counter(analysis_results['publisher_clues']).most_common(1)[0][0]
print(f' 2009 Reissue Publisher: {top_publisher}')
else:
print(' 2009 Reissue Publisher: [Not definitively identified from search results]')

# Save comprehensive analysis
results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, 'comprehensive_book_analysis.json')
with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump(analysis_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS SAVED TO: {results_file}')

if evidence_score >= 60:
print('\n‚úÖ BOOK SUCCESSFULLY IDENTIFIED WITH HIGH CONFIDENCE!')
print('\nThe 1851 co-authored book on atheistic naturalism with phrenology/mesmerism')
print('content that was controversial and reissued in 2009 is:')
print('\n"Letters on the Laws of Man\'s Nature and Development"')
print('by Harriet Martineau and Henry George Atkinson')
else:
print('\n‚ùì PARTIAL IDENTIFICATION - Additional research may be needed')
print('Based on historical knowledge, this is most likely:')
print('"Letters on the Laws of Man\'s Nature and Development"')
print('by Harriet Martineau and Henry George Atkinson (1851)')

print('\n=== HTML ANALYSIS FOR 1851 ATHEISTIC NATURALISM BOOK COMPLETE ===')
```

### Development Step 4: Locate 1851 Atheistic Naturalism Phrenology Mesmerism Book and 2009 Reissuing Publisher

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify a co-authored book from 1851 that advocated for atheistic naturalism, systematically explored phrenology and mesmerism, was controversial for these topics, and was reissued by a publisher in 2009. Search using keywords including '1851 book atheistic naturalism phrenology mesmerism co-authored', '1851 controversial book phrenology mesmerism reissued 2009', 'atheistic naturalism 1851 publication', and 'phrenology mesmerism 1851 authors'. Focus on identifying both the original 1851 publication details and the specific publisher who reissued it in 2009.

**Use Cases**:
- University research library digitization team using the multi-engine search script to locate and verify obscure 1851 scientific texts for digital archive inclusion and confirm 2009 reissue details.
- Historical society librarian employing automated Google Scholar, Bing, JSTOR, and archive.org queries to compile a complete bibliography of co-authored controversial phrenology and mesmerism treatises for a museum exhibition.
- Digital humanities scholar mapping the spread of atheistic naturalism by systematically harvesting primary sources and modern reprint information from multiple search engines for network analysis.
- Rare bookseller validating a potential 1851 first edition‚Äôs provenance by cross-referencing academic databases and general web searches to confirm authorship, publication history, and a 2009 specialty press reissue.
- PhD candidate in history of science leveraging the Python multi-method search to uncover mid-19th century philosophical works on phrenology and mesmerism across library catalogs and online archives for dissertation research.
- Independent publisher‚Äôs research team discovering forgotten public domain texts for annotated reissues by scanning academic sites and search engines to identify obscure co-authored volumes and track modern rights holders.
- Data journalist investigating the revival of fringe-science publications by extracting publication metadata and reissue patterns from search logs to illustrate how 19th-century controversial works reappear in contemporary niche markets.

```
import os
import requests
import json
import time
from urllib.parse import quote_plus
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup

print('=== ALTERNATIVE SEARCH STRATEGY FOR 1851 ATHEISTIC NATURALISM BOOK ===')
print('Previous attempts failed due to API rate limits (SERPAPI) and HTTP 202 responses (DuckDuckGo)')
print('Implementing multi-pronged approach with different search engines and methods\n')

# Ensure workspace directory exists
os.makedirs('workspace', exist_ok=True)

# Initialize comprehensive results storage
search_results = {
'timestamp': time.strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'),
'objective': 'Find 1851 co-authored book on atheistic naturalism with phrenology/mesmerism, reissued 2009',
'search_methods': [],
'all_findings': [],
'book_candidates': [],
'analysis_summary': {}
}

print('TARGET BOOK CHARACTERISTICS:')
print('‚Ä¢ Published: 1851')
print('‚Ä¢ Co-authored (multiple authors)')
print('‚Ä¢ Topic: Atheistic naturalism')
print('‚Ä¢ Contains: Phrenology and mesmerism content')
print('‚Ä¢ Controversial for these topics')
print('‚Ä¢ Reissued by a publisher in 2009')
print()

# Method 1: Try Google Scholar search using requests
print('=== METHOD 1: GOOGLE SCHOLAR DIRECT SEARCH ===')
print('=' * 60)

scholar_queries = [
'"atheistic naturalism" 1851 phrenology mesmerism',
'1851 controversial book phrenology mesmerism authors',
'phrenology mesmerism 1851 naturalism philosophy'
]

headers = {
'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36',
'Accept': 'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,*/*;q=0.8',
'Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9',
'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate, br',
'Connection': 'keep-alive'
}

for i, query in enumerate(scholar_queries, 1):
print(f'\nGoogle Scholar Search {i}: {query}')
try:
scholar_url = f'https://scholar.google.com/scholar?q={quote_plus(query)}'
print(f'URL: {scholar_url}')

response = requests.get(scholar_url, headers=headers, timeout=20)
print(f'Status: {response.status_code}')

if response.status_code == 200:
# Save raw HTML
filename = f'google_scholar_search_{i}.html'
filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename)
with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write(response.text)
print(f'Saved: {filepath}')

# Quick parse for academic results
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

# Look for result titles in Google Scholar
result_titles = soup.find_all(['h3', 'a'], class_=lambda x: x and 'gs_rt' in str(x))
if not result_titles:
result_titles = soup.find_all('h3')

print(f'Found {len(result_titles)} potential results')

for j, title_elem in enumerate(result_titles[:5], 1):
title_text = title_elem.get_text().strip()
if len(title_text) > 10:
print(f' {j}. {title_text[:100]}...')

# Check for key terms
text_lower = title_text.lower()
relevance_indicators = []
if '1851' in text_lower: relevance_indicators.append('1851')
if 'phrenology' in text_lower: relevance_indicators.append('phrenology')
if 'mesmerism' in text_lower: relevance_indicators.append('mesmerism')
if 'naturalism' in text_lower: relevance_indicators.append('naturalism')

if relevance_indicators:
print(f' ‚≠ê Relevant terms: {', '.join(relevance_indicators)}')
search_results['all_findings'].append({
'source': 'Google Scholar',
'query': query,
'title': title_text,
'relevance_terms': relevance_indicators,
'method': 'scholar_direct'
})

search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Google Scholar: {query} - Status {response.status_code}')
else:
print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}')

except Exception as e:
print(f'Error: {str(e)}')

time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting

# Method 2: Try Bing search
print('\n=== METHOD 2: BING SEARCH ===')
print('=' * 40)

bing_queries = [
'"1851" "atheistic naturalism" phrenology mesmerism book',
'1851 controversial phrenology mesmerism co-authored book',
'phrenology mesmerism 1851 naturalism reissued 2009'
]

for i, query in enumerate(bing_queries, 1):
print(f'\nBing Search {i}: {query}')
try:
bing_url = f'https://www.bing.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}'
print(f'URL: {bing_url}')

response = requests.get(bing_url, headers=headers, timeout=20)
print(f'Status: {response.status_code}')

if response.status_code == 200:
# Save raw HTML
filename = f'bing_search_{i}.html'
filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename)
with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write(response.text)
print(f'Saved: {filepath}')

# Parse for results
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

# Look for Bing result titles
result_links = soup.find_all('a', href=True)
relevant_results = []

for link in result_links:
link_text = link.get_text().strip()
href = link.get('href')

if len(link_text) > 15 and href:
text_lower = link_text.lower()
relevance_score = 0
matched_terms = []

key_terms = {'1851': 3, 'phrenology': 2, 'mesmerism': 2, 'naturalism': 2, 'atheistic': 2, 'book': 1}

for term, weight in key_terms.items():
if term in text_lower:
relevance_score += weight
matched_terms.append(term)

if relevance_score >= 3:
relevant_results.append({
'text': link_text[:150],
'href': href,
'score': relevance_score,
'terms': matched_terms
})

print(f'Found {len(relevant_results)} relevant results')
for j, result in enumerate(relevant_results[:3], 1):
print(f' {j}. Score {result["score"]}: {result["text"]}...')
print(f' Terms: {', '.join(result["terms"])}')

search_results['all_findings'].append({
'source': 'Bing',
'query': query,
'title': result['text'],
'link': result['href'],
'relevance_score': result['score'],
'relevance_terms': result['terms'],
'method': 'bing_direct'
})

search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Bing: {query} - Status {response.status_code}')
else:
print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}')

except Exception as e:
print(f'Error: {str(e)}')

time.sleep(3) # Rate limiting

# Method 3: Try specific academic database searches
print('\n=== METHOD 3: ACADEMIC DATABASE SEARCHES ===')
print('=' * 50)

# Try JSTOR, Project MUSE, and other academic sources
academic_sites = [
'site:jstor.org',
'site:muse.jhu.edu',
'site:archive.org',
'site:hathitrust.org'
]

base_query = '1851 atheistic naturalism phrenology mesmerism'

for i, site in enumerate(academic_sites, 1):
query = f'{site} {base_query}'
print(f'\nAcademic Search {i}: {query}')

try:
# Use Google to search specific academic sites
google_url = f'https://www.google.com/search?q={quote_plus(query)}'
print(f'URL: {google_url}')

response = requests.get(google_url, headers=headers, timeout=20)
print(f'Status: {response.status_code}')

if response.status_code == 200:
filename = f'academic_search_{i}_{site.replace("site:", "").replace(".", "_")}.html'
filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename)
with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write(response.text)
print(f'Saved: {filepath}')

# Quick analysis
soup = BeautifulSoup(response.text, 'html.parser')

# Look for Google result snippets
snippets = soup.find_all(['span', 'div'], class_=lambda x: x and 'st' in str(x).lower())

relevant_snippets = []
for snippet in snippets:
snippet_text = snippet.get_text().strip()
if len(snippet_text) > 20:
text_lower = snippet_text.lower()
if any(term in text_lower for term in ['1851', 'phrenology', 'mesmerism', 'naturalism']):
relevant_snippets.append(snippet_text[:200])

print(f'Found {len(relevant_snippets)} relevant snippets')
for j, snippet in enumerate(relevant_snippets[:2], 1):
print(f' {j}. {snippet}...')

search_results['all_findings'].append({
'source': f'Academic - {site}',
'query': query,
'snippet': snippet,
'method': 'academic_site_search'
})

search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Academic {site}: Status {response.status_code}')
else:
print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}')

except Exception as e:
print(f'Error: {str(e)}')

time.sleep(4) # Longer delay for Google

# Method 4: Try alternative search engines
print('\n=== METHOD 4: ALTERNATIVE SEARCH ENGINES ===')
print('=' * 50)

# Try Startpage (uses Google results but with privacy)
startpage_query = '"1851" phrenology mesmerism atheistic naturalism book'
print(f'\nStartpage Search: {startpage_query}')

try:
startpage_url = f'https://www.startpage.com/sp/search?query={quote_plus(startpage_query)}'
print(f'URL: {startpage_url}')

response = requests.get(startpage_url, headers=headers, timeout=20)
print(f'Status: {response.status_code}')

if response.status_code == 200:
filename = 'startpage_search.html'
filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename)
with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
f.write(response.text)
print(f'Saved: {filepath}')

search_results['search_methods'].append(f'Startpage: Status {response.status_code}')
else:
print(f'Failed with status {response.status_code}')

except Exception as e:
print(f'Error: {str(e)}')

# Analyze all findings
print('\n' + '=' * 80)
print('COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF ALL SEARCH METHODS')
print('=' * 80)

total_findings = len(search_results['all_findings'])
print(f'Total findings collected: {total_findings}')
print(f'Search methods attempted: {len(search_results["search_methods"])}')

if search_results['all_findings']:
print('\nüîç ALL FINDINGS ANALYSIS:')
print('-' * 40)

# Group by source
by_source = {}
for finding in search_results['all_findings']:
source = finding['source']
if source not in by_source:
by_source[source] = []
by_source[source].append(finding)

for source, findings in by_source.items():
print(f'\n{source} ({len(findings)} findings):')
for i, finding in enumerate(findings, 1):
title = finding.get('title', finding.get('snippet', 'No title'))[:100]
terms = finding.get('relevance_terms', [])
score = finding.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')
print(f' {i}. {title}... (Score: {score}, Terms: {", ".join(terms)})')

# Identify potential book candidates
book_indicators = ['book', 'work', 'treatise', 'publication', 'volume']
year_indicators = ['1851']
topic_indicators = ['phrenology', 'mesmerism', 'naturalism', 'atheistic']

for finding in search_results['all_findings']:
text_content = (finding.get('title', '') + ' ' + finding.get('snippet', '')).lower()

has_book = any(indicator in text_content for indicator in book_indicators)
has_year = any(indicator in text_content for indicator in year_indicators)
has_topic = any(indicator in text_content for indicator in topic_indicators)

if has_book and has_year and has_topic:
search_results['book_candidates'].append(finding)

print(f'\nüìö POTENTIAL BOOK CANDIDATES: {len(search_results["book_candidates"])}')
for i, candidate in enumerate(search_results['book_candidates'], 1):
print(f'\n{i}. Source: {candidate["source"]}')
print(f' Title/Snippet: {candidate.get("title", candidate.get("snippet", "No content"))[:150]}...')
print(f' Terms: {candidate.get("relevance_terms", [])}')
print(f' Score: {candidate.get("relevance_score", "N/A")}')

else:
print('\n‚ùå No findings collected from any search method')
print('This suggests the book may be:')
print('1. Very obscure or not well-digitized')
print('2. Known by a different title or description')
print('3. Not matching our exact search terms')

# Save comprehensive results
results_file = os.path.join('workspace', 'comprehensive_1851_book_search.json')
with open(results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f:
json.dump(search_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)

print(f'\nüíæ COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH RESULTS SAVED TO: {results_file}')

# Summary statistics
search_results['analysis_summary'] = {
'total_findings': total_findings,
'book_candidates': len(search_results['book_candidates']),
'search_methods_attempted': len(search_results['search_methods']),
'successful_searches': len([m for m in search_results['search_methods'] if '200' in m]),
'sources_used': list(set([f['source'] for f in search_results['all_findings']])) if search_results['all_findings'] else []
}

print(f'\nüìä FINAL SEARCH STATISTICS:')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Total findings: {search_results["analysis_summary"]["total_findings"]}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Book candidates: {search_results["analysis_summary"]["book_candidates"]}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Methods attempted: {search_results["analysis_summary"]["search_methods_attempted"]}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Successful searches: {search_results["analysis_summary"]["successful_searches"]}')
print(f' ‚Ä¢ Sources accessed: {search_results["analysis_summary"]["sources_used"]}')

print('\nüéØ RECOMMENDED NEXT STEPS:')
if search_results['book_candidates']:
print('1. ‚úÖ Investigate specific book candidates found')
print('2. ‚úÖ Follow up on promising links and sources')
print('3. ‚úÖ Search for 2009 reissue information')
else:
print('1. üîÑ Try more specific author name searches')
print('2. üîÑ Search for "controversial 1851 books" generally')
print('3. üîÑ Look into 19th century philosophy/science book catalogs')
print('4. üîÑ Search academic databases for phrenology/mesmerism history')

print('5. üìã Review all saved HTML files for additional context')
print('6. üîç Consider library catalog searches (WorldCat, etc.)')

print('\n=== COMPREHENSIVE MULTI-METHOD SEARCH COMPLETE ===')
```

### Development Step 5: Identify 1851 Atheistic Naturalism Book on Phrenology/Mesmerism and Its 2009 Reissue Publisher

**Description**: Conduct a comprehensive web search to identify a co-authored book from 1851 that advocated for atheistic naturalism, systematically explored phrenology and mesmerism, was controversial for these topics, and was reissued by a publisher in 2009. Search using keywords including '1851 book atheistic naturalism phrenology mesmerism co-authored', '1851 controversial book phrenology mesmerism reissued 2009', 'atheistic naturalism 1851 publication', and 'phrenology mesmerism 1851 authors'. Focus on identifying both the original 1851 publication details and the specific publisher who reissued it in 2009.

**Use Cases**:
- Academic historian automating the identification of obscure 19th-century texts and their modern reissue details for a journal article on atheistic naturalism controversies
- Library metadata specialist using targeted web and scholarly search scripts to update collection records with publication dates, co-authors, and reprint publisher information
- Digital humanities project integrating automated web scraping and match-scoring to curate a dataset of phrenology and mesmerism publications for network and discourse analysis
- Publishing house acquisitions team conducting due diligence on public domain works by detecting original 1851 publication details and 2009 reissue rights before green-lighting a new edition
- Intellectual property attorney verifying authorship, publication history, and modern publisher claims for 19th-century texts in a litigation involving contested reprint rights
- Graduate student building a reproducible search pipeline to gather evidence on historical debates in naturalism, phrenology, and mesmerism for a dissertation timeline and annotated bibliography
- Cultural heritage institution employing automated Google Scholar analysis to tag and contextualize controversial topics in its digital archive of 19th-century manuscripts
