Code Output: === ACCESSING THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE AND ANALYZING IMAGES === Objective: Download archived Thieme-Becker page and extract chronological dates from images Using existing workspace directory: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f === INSPECTING PREVIOUS CITATION EXTRACTION RESULTS === Found citation file: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f/carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json Citation file keys: ['extraction_metadata', 'citation_statistics', 'first_citation_reference', 'all_citation_references', 'all_reference_links', 'all_external_links'] First citation reference structure: ['reference_number', 'url', 'link_text', 'full_reference', 'type'] Target URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker Reference text: N/A Target Thieme-Becker URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker === RETRIEVING THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE === Fetching: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker ‚úÖ Successfully retrieved Thieme-Becker page Content length: 181,560 bytes Content type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 Response encoding: UTF-8 === PARSING HTML CONTENT === Page title: Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia ‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: thieme_becker_archived_page.html (181,560 bytes) Main content area identified: div === EXTRACTING ALL IMAGES FROM PAGE === Found 3 image elements on the page Image 1: Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg Alt text: Title: Dimensions: 220 x 357 Classes: ['thumbimage'] Image 2: Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/15px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png Alt text: Title: Wikisource Dimensions: 15 x 16 Classes: [] Image 3: Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:CentralAutoLogin/start?type=1x1 Alt text: Title: Dimensions: 1 x 1 Classes: [] === FILTERING CONTENT IMAGES === Identified 0 content images (excluding decorative/system images) === DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES === === COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS === Total images analyzed: 0 ‚ùå No chronological years found in any images === SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS === ‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: thieme_becker_image_analysis.json File size: 491 bytes ‚úÖ Summary report saved to: thieme_becker_analysis_summary.txt === THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE === ‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found in any images on the page üìÅ All data and images saved to workspace: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f ‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed successfully!
developer Code Execution - Plan 02 (Iteration 2)
2025-08-11 06:21:08

Code execution result:

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== CORRECTED THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS WITH PROPER FILTERING ===") print("Objective: Fix filtering criteria "keyword">and analyze all relevant images "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Use existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # First, let's inspect the saved HTML file to understand the page structure html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(html_file): print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Found saved HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)") # Load "keyword">and parse the saved HTML "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title').get_text().strip() "keyword">if soup.find('title') "keyword">else 'Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;body') "keyword">or soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract all images "keyword">with detailed analysis print(f"\n=== DETAILED IMAGE EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS ===") all_images = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Found {len(all_images)} image elements on the page") image_details = [] "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): img_info = { &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': img.get('src', ''), &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;width': img.get('width', ''), &#x27;height': img.get('height', ''), &#x27;"keyword">class': img.get('"keyword">class', []), &#x27;full_element': str(img) } print(f"\nImage {i} - Detailed Analysis:") print(f" Source: {img_info[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{img_info['alt']}'") print(f" Title: &#x27;{img_info['title']}'") print(f" Dimensions: {img_info[&#x27;width']} x {img_info['height']}") print(f" Classes: {img_info[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") # Analyze "keyword">if this "keyword">is a content image "keyword">with corrected criteria is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None # Check "keyword">for system/decorative image patterns src = img_info[&#x27;src'].lower() alt = img_info[&#x27;alt'].lower() system_patterns = [ &#x27;wikisource-logo', &#x27;commons-logo', &#x27;wikimedia-logo', &#x27;edit-icon', &#x27;external-link', &#x27;centralautologin', # The 1x1 tracking pixel &#x27;blank.gif', &#x27;spacer.gif', &#x27;pixel.gif' ] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in system_patterns: "keyword">if pattern "keyword">in src "keyword">or pattern "keyword">in alt: is_content_image = "keyword">False exclusion_reason = f"System/decorative pattern: {pattern}" "keyword">break # Check dimensions - be more permissive "keyword">for content images "keyword">if is_content_image: "keyword">try: width = int(img_info[&#x27;width']) "keyword">if img_info['width'] "keyword">else 0 height = int(img_info[&#x27;height']) "keyword">if img_info['height'] "keyword">else 0 # Only exclude very small images (likely icons/pixels) "keyword">if width > 0 "keyword">and height > 0 "keyword">and (width <= 10 "keyword">and height <= 10): is_content_image = "keyword">False exclusion_reason = f"Too small: {width}x{height} (likely icon/pixel)" "keyword">elif width >= 50 "keyword">or height >= 50: # Any image "keyword">with at least one dimension >= 50px "keyword">is likely content is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">pass # Keep "keyword">as content image "keyword">if dimensions can't be parsed # Special consideration "keyword">for thumbimage "keyword">class (Wikipedia thumbnail images) "keyword">if &#x27;thumbimage' "keyword">in img_info['"keyword">class']: is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None print(f" ‚úÖ Identified "keyword">as thumbnail content image (thumbimage "keyword">class)") img_info[&#x27;is_content_image'] = is_content_image img_info[&#x27;exclusion_reason'] = exclusion_reason "keyword">if is_content_image: print(f" ‚úÖ CONTENT IMAGE - Will be analyzed") "keyword">else: print(f" ‚ùå EXCLUDED - {exclusion_reason}") image_details.append(img_info) # Filter content images "keyword">with corrected criteria content_images = [img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img[&#x27;is_content_image']] print(f"\n=== CONTENT IMAGES IDENTIFIED ===") print(f"Total content images: {len(content_images)}") "keyword">for img "keyword">in content_images: print(f"\nContent Image {img[&#x27;image_number']}:") print(f" Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{img['alt']}'") print(f" Title: &#x27;{img['title']}'") print(f" Dimensions: {img[&#x27;width']} x {img['height']}") print(f" Classes: {img[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") "keyword">if "keyword">not content_images: print("‚ùå No content images identified "keyword">for analysis") exit() # Download "keyword">and analyze each content image print(f"\n=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES ===") # Get the base URL "keyword">for resolving relative image URLs thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker" base_archive_url = "http://web.archive.org" headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9' } image_analysis_results = [] "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(content_images, 1): print(f"\nAnalyzing Content Image {i}/{len(content_images)}") print(f"Original source: {img_info[&#x27;src']}") img_src = img_info[&#x27;src'] # Handle relative URLs "keyword">for archived content "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/web/'): img_src = base_archive_url + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = base_archive_url + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = urljoin(thieme_becker_url, img_src) print(f"Resolved image URL: {img_src}") "keyword">try: # Download the image print(f"Downloading image...") img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if img_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)") # Determine file extension img_extension = &#x27;jpg' # Default content_type = img_response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;png' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.png' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;png' "keyword">elif &#x27;gif' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.gif' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;gif' "keyword">elif &#x27;svg' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.svg' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;svg' "keyword">elif &#x27;webp' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.webp' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;webp' # Save the image img_filename = f"thieme_becker_content_image_{i}.{img_extension}" img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename) "keyword">with open(img_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(img_response.content) print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}") # Analyze the image "keyword">for text content using OCR print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):") print(f"Raw extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;='*60}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*60}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\nüîç Searching "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in extracted text...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\-]\d{1,2}[./\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\-]\d{1,2}[./\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) match_context = extracted_text[max(0, match.start()-20):match.end()+20] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year} (Pattern: {description})") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}' "keyword">in context: '{match_context.strip()}'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) # Simple Roman numeral to year conversion "keyword">for common patterns "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral} (manual interpretation may be needed)") # Store comprehensive analysis results analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;extracted_text_length': len(extracted_text), &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;latest_year': max(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years) } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">if found_years: latest_year = max(found_years) print(f"\nüìÖ SUMMARY FOR THIS IMAGE:") print(f" Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}") print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}") print(f" Total years: {len(found_years)}") "keyword">else: print(f"\nüìÖ No chronological years found "keyword">in this image") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image (OCR returned empty result)") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': 'No text extracted', &#x27;extracted_text': '', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': 'OCR client "keyword">not available', &#x27;extracted_text': 'OCR "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': str(ocr_error), &#x27;extracted_text': f'OCR failed: {str(ocr_error)}', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}") print(f"Response headers: {dict(img_response.headers)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': "keyword">None, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;download_failure_reason': f'HTTP {img_response.status_code}', &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;extracted_text': '', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': "keyword">None, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;download_failure_reason': str(e), &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;extracted_text': f'Error: {str(e)}', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) # Add delay between image downloads time.sleep(2) # Comprehensive analysis of all results print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"COMPREHENSIVE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS") print(f"="*80) print(f"Total images analyzed: {len(image_analysis_results)}") successful_downloads = len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r[&#x27;download_success']]) successful_ocr = len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False)]) print(f"Successful downloads: {successful_downloads}") print(f"Successful OCR extractions: {successful_ocr}") # Collect all years found across all images all_years_found = [] all_pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;found_years'): all_years_found.extend(result[&#x27;found_years']) "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): all_pattern_matches.extend(result[&#x27;pattern_matches']) print(f"\nüìä CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS SUMMARY:") "keyword">if all_years_found: unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found) print(f" Total years found: {len(all_years_found)}") print(f" Unique years: {len(unique_years)}") print(f" Year range: {min(unique_years)} - {max(unique_years)}") print(f" All unique years: {unique_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_overall_year}") # Find which image(s) contained the latest year images_with_latest_year = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;latest_year') == latest_overall_year: images_with_latest_year.append(result) print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_overall_year}) FOUND IN:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in images_with_latest_year: print(f" Image {result[&#x27;image_number']}: {result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}") print(f" Dimensions: {result[&#x27;image_dimensions']}") print(f" Classes: {result[&#x27;image_classes']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{result['image_alt']}'") print(f" All years "keyword">in this image: {result.get(&#x27;found_years', [])}") # Show the specific pattern matches "keyword">for the latest year "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): latest_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in result[&#x27;pattern_matches'] "keyword">if m['year'] == latest_overall_year] "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_matches: print(f" Match context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Pattern type: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print() # Show detailed breakdown by image print(f"üìã DETAILED BREAKDOWN BY IMAGE:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;found_years'): print(f"\n Image {result[&#x27;image_number']} ({result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}):") print(f" Years found: {result[&#x27;found_years']}") print(f" Latest year: {result.get(&#x27;latest_year')}") print(f" Text length: {result.get(&#x27;extracted_text_length', 0)} characters") "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): print(f" Pattern matches:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in result[&#x27;pattern_matches'][:3]: # Show first 3 matches print(f" - {match[&#x27;year']}: '{match['context']}'") "keyword">else: print(f" ‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in any images") print(f"\nüìã OCR EXTRACTION RESULTS:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: print(f"\n Image {result[&#x27;image_number']} ({result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}):") print(f" Download success: {result[&#x27;download_success']}") print(f" OCR success: {result.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False)}") "keyword">if "keyword">not result.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False): print(f" Failure reason: {result.get(&#x27;ocr_failure_reason', 'Unknown')}") "keyword">else: text_preview = result.get(&#x27;extracted_text', '')[:100] print(f" Text preview: &#x27;{text_preview}...'") # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': thieme_becker_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;total_images_found': len(all_images), &#x27;content_images_identified': len(content_images), &#x27;images_analyzed': len(image_analysis_results), &#x27;successful_downloads': successful_downloads, &#x27;successful_ocr_extractions': successful_ocr }, &#x27;image_analysis_results': image_analysis_results, &#x27;chronological_summary': { &#x27;all_years_found': all_years_found, &#x27;unique_years': sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': max(all_years_found) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_years_found) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(all_years_found), &#x27;unique_years_count': len(set(all_years_found)) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else 0, &#x27;images_with_years': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get('found_years')]), &#x27;pattern_matches': all_pattern_matches } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_corrected_image_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes") # Create detailed summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_final_analysis_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE - CORRECTED IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS\n") f.write(f"={"="*75}\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Source URL: {thieme_becker_url}\n") f.write(f"Page Title: {page_title}\n\n") f.write(f"IMAGE STATISTICS:\n") f.write(f"- Total images found on page: {len(all_images)}\n") f.write(f"- Content images identified: {len(content_images)}\n") f.write(f"- Images successfully downloaded: {successful_downloads}\n") f.write(f"- Images "keyword">with successful OCR: {successful_ocr}\n") f.write(f"- Images "keyword">with chronological years: {len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get(&#x27;found_years')])}\n\n") "keyword">if all_years_found: unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\n") f.write(f"- Total years found: {len(all_years_found)}\n") f.write(f"- Unique years: {len(unique_years)}\n") f.write(f"- Year range: {min(unique_years)} - {max(unique_years)}\n") f.write(f"- All unique years: {unique_years}\n") f.write(f"- LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {max(all_years_found)}\n\n") f.write(f"IMAGES CONTAINING LATEST YEAR ({max(all_years_found)}):") images_with_latest = [r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get(&#x27;latest_year') == max(all_years_found)] "keyword">for result "keyword">in images_with_latest: f.write(f"\n- Image {result[&#x27;image_number']}: {result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}") f.write(f"\n Dimensions: {result[&#x27;image_dimensions']}") f.write(f"\n Alt text: &#x27;{result['image_alt']}'") f.write(f"\n All years: {result.get(&#x27;found_years', [])}") "keyword">else: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found "keyword">in any images\n") f.write(f"\nTROUBLESHOoting INFO:\n") "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: f.write(f"\n- Image {result[&#x27;image_number']}:") f.write(f"\n Download: {result[&#x27;download_success']}") f.write(f"\n OCR: {result.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False)}") "keyword">if "keyword">not result.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False): f.write(f"\n Issue: {result.get(&#x27;ocr_failure_reason', 'Unknown')}") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print(f"="*80) "keyword">if all_years_found: latest_year = max(all_years_found) print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in images: {latest_year}") print(f"üìä Total unique years found: {len(set(all_years_found))}") print(f"üìã All unique years: {sorted(list(set(all_years_found)))}") print(f"üìç Found "keyword">in {len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get(&#x27;latest_year') == latest_year])} image(s)") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found "keyword">in any images on the page") print(f"üìä Images processed: {len(image_analysis_results)}") print(f"üìä Successful downloads: {successful_downloads}") print(f"üìä Successful OCR: {successful_ocr}") print(f"\nüìÅ All data "keyword">and images saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Corrected Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed!")
üìÑ Output
Code Output: === CORRECTED THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS WITH PROPER FILTERING === Objective: Fix filtering criteria and analyze all relevant images for chronological dates Using existing workspace directory: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f Found saved HTML file: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f/thieme_becker_archived_page.html (181,560 bytes) Page title: Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia Main content area identified: div === DETAILED IMAGE EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS === Found 3 image elements on the page Image 1 - System/decorative pattern: centralautologin === CONTENT IMAGES IDENTIFIED === Total content images: 1 Content Image 1: Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg Alt text: '' Title: '' Dimensions: 220 x 357 Classes: ['thumbimage'] === DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES === Analyzing Content Image 1/1 Original source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg Resolved image URL: https://web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg Downloading image... üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== CORRECTED THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS WITH PROPER FILTERING ===") print("Objective: Fix filtering criteria "keyword">and analyze all relevant images "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Use existing workspace directory workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # First, let's inspect the saved HTML file to understand the page structure html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(html_file): print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Found saved HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)") # Load "keyword">and parse the saved HTML "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title').get_text().strip() "keyword">if soup.find('title') "keyword">else 'Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;body') "keyword">or soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract all images "keyword">with detailed analysis print(f"\n=== DETAILED IMAGE EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS ===") all_images = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Found {len(all_images)} image elements on the page") image_details = [] "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): img_info = { &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': img.get('src', ''), &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;width': img.get('width', ''), &#x27;height': img.get('height', ''), &#x27;"keyword">class': img.get('"keyword">class', []), &#x27;full_element': str(img) } print(f"\nImage {i} - Detailed Analysis:") print(f" Source: {img_info[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{img_info['alt']}'") print(f" Title: &#x27;{img_info['title']}'") print(f" Dimensions: {img_info[&#x27;width']} x {img_info['height']}") print(f" Classes: {img_info[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") # Analyze "keyword">if this "keyword">is a content image "keyword">with corrected criteria is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None # Check "keyword">for system/decorative image patterns src = img_info[&#x27;src'].lower() alt = img_info[&#x27;alt'].lower() system_patterns = [ &#x27;wikisource-logo', &#x27;commons-logo', &#x27;wikimedia-logo', &#x27;edit-icon', &#x27;external-link', &#x27;centralautologin', # The 1x1 tracking pixel &#x27;blank.gif', &#x27;spacer.gif', &#x27;pixel.gif' ] "keyword">for pattern "keyword">in system_patterns: "keyword">if pattern "keyword">in src "keyword">or pattern "keyword">in alt: is_content_image = "keyword">False exclusion_reason = f"System/decorative pattern: {pattern}" "keyword">break # Check dimensions - be more permissive "keyword">for content images "keyword">if is_content_image: "keyword">try: width = int(img_info[&#x27;width']) "keyword">if img_info['width'] "keyword">else 0 height = int(img_info[&#x27;height']) "keyword">if img_info['height'] "keyword">else 0 # Only exclude very small images (likely icons/pixels) "keyword">if width > 0 "keyword">and height > 0 "keyword">and (width <= 10 "keyword">and height <= 10): is_content_image = "keyword">False exclusion_reason = f"Too small: {width}x{height} (likely icon/pixel)" "keyword">elif width >= 50 "keyword">or height >= 50: # Any image "keyword">with at least one dimension >= 50px "keyword">is likely content is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">pass # Keep "keyword">as content image "keyword">if dimensions can't be parsed # Special consideration "keyword">for thumbimage "keyword">class (Wikipedia thumbnail images) "keyword">if &#x27;thumbimage' "keyword">in img_info['"keyword">class']: is_content_image = "keyword">True exclusion_reason = "keyword">None print(f" ‚úÖ Identified "keyword">as thumbnail content image (thumbimage "keyword">class)") img_info[&#x27;is_content_image'] = is_content_image img_info[&#x27;exclusion_reason'] = exclusion_reason "keyword">if is_content_image: print(f" ‚úÖ CONTENT IMAGE - Will be analyzed") "keyword">else: print(f" ‚ùå EXCLUDED - {exclusion_reason}") image_details.append(img_info) # Filter content images "keyword">with corrected criteria content_images = [img "keyword">for img "keyword">in image_details "keyword">if img[&#x27;is_content_image']] print(f"\n=== CONTENT IMAGES IDENTIFIED ===") print(f"Total content images: {len(content_images)}") "keyword">for img "keyword">in content_images: print(f"\nContent Image {img[&#x27;image_number']}:") print(f" Source: {img[&#x27;src']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{img['alt']}'") print(f" Title: &#x27;{img['title']}'") print(f" Dimensions: {img[&#x27;width']} x {img['height']}") print(f" Classes: {img[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") "keyword">if "keyword">not content_images: print("‚ùå No content images identified "keyword">for analysis") exit() # Download "keyword">and analyze each content image print(f"\n=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES ===") # Get the base URL "keyword">for resolving relative image URLs thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker" base_archive_url = "http://web.archive.org" headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9' } image_analysis_results = [] "keyword">for i, img_info "keyword">in enumerate(content_images, 1): print(f"\nAnalyzing Content Image {i}/{len(content_images)}") print(f"Original source: {img_info[&#x27;src']}") img_src = img_info[&#x27;src'] # Handle relative URLs "keyword">for archived content "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/web/'): img_src = base_archive_url + img_src "keyword">elif img_src.startswith(&#x27;/'): img_src = base_archive_url + img_src "keyword">elif "keyword">not img_src.startswith(&#x27;http'): img_src = urljoin(thieme_becker_url, img_src) print(f"Resolved image URL: {img_src}") "keyword">try: # Download the image print(f"Downloading image...") img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if img_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)") # Determine file extension img_extension = &#x27;jpg' # Default content_type = img_response.headers.get(&#x27;content-type', '').lower() "keyword">if &#x27;png' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.png' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;png' "keyword">elif &#x27;gif' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.gif' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;gif' "keyword">elif &#x27;svg' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.svg' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;svg' "keyword">elif &#x27;webp' "keyword">in content_type "keyword">or '.webp' "keyword">in img_src.lower(): img_extension = &#x27;webp' # Save the image img_filename = f"thieme_becker_content_image_{i}.{img_extension}" img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename) "keyword">with open(img_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(img_response.content) print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}") # Analyze the image "keyword">for text content using OCR print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):") print(f"Raw extracted text:") print(f"{&#x27;='*60}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*60}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\nüîç Searching "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in extracted text...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\-]\d{1,2}[./\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\-]\d{1,2}[./\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) match_context = extracted_text[max(0, match.start()-20):match.end()+20] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year} (Pattern: {description})") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}' "keyword">in context: '{match_context.strip()}'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) # Simple Roman numeral to year conversion "keyword">for common patterns "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral} (manual interpretation may be needed)") # Store comprehensive analysis results analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;extracted_text_length': len(extracted_text), &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;latest_year': max(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years) } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">if found_years: latest_year = max(found_years) print(f"\nüìÖ SUMMARY FOR THIS IMAGE:") print(f" Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}") print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}") print(f" Total years: {len(found_years)}") "keyword">else: print(f"\nüìÖ No chronological years found "keyword">in this image") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image (OCR returned empty result)") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': 'No text extracted', &#x27;extracted_text': '', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': 'OCR client "keyword">not available', &#x27;extracted_text': 'OCR "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">True, &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;ocr_failure_reason': str(ocr_error), &#x27;extracted_text': f'OCR failed: {str(ocr_error)}', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}") print(f"Response headers: {dict(img_response.headers)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': "keyword">None, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;download_failure_reason': f'HTTP "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}") analysis_result = { &#x27;image_number': img_info['image_number'], &#x27;image_filename': "keyword">None, &#x27;image_src': img_info['src'], &#x27;image_alt': img_info['alt'], &#x27;image_title': img_info['title'], &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{img_info['width']}x{img_info['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': img_info['"keyword">class'], &#x27;download_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;download_failure_reason': str(e), &#x27;ocr_success': "keyword">False, &#x27;extracted_text': f'Error: {str(e)}', &#x27;found_years': [], &#x27;latest_year': "keyword">None } image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result) # Add delay between image downloads time.sleep(2) # Comprehensive analysis of all results print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"COMPREHENSIVE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS") print(f"="*80) print(f"Total images analyzed: {len(image_analysis_results)}") successful_downloads = len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r[&#x27;download_success']]) successful_ocr = len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False)]) print(f"Successful downloads: {successful_downloads}") print(f"Successful OCR extractions: {successful_ocr}") # Collect all years found across all images all_years_found = [] all_pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;found_years'): all_years_found.extend(result[&#x27;found_years']) "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): all_pattern_matches.extend(result[&#x27;pattern_matches']) print(f"\nüìä CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS SUMMARY:") "keyword">if all_years_found: unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found) print(f" Total years found: {len(all_years_found)}") print(f" Unique years: {len(unique_years)}") print(f" Year range: {min(unique_years)} - {max(unique_years)}") print(f" All unique years: {unique_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_overall_year}") # Find which image(s) contained the latest year images_with_latest_year = [] "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;latest_year') == latest_overall_year: images_with_latest_year.append(result) print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_overall_year}) FOUND IN:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in images_with_latest_year: print(f" Image {result[&#x27;image_number']}: {result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}") print(f" Dimensions: {result[&#x27;image_dimensions']}") print(f" Classes: {result[&#x27;image_classes']}") print(f" Alt text: &#x27;{result['image_alt']}'") print(f" All years "keyword">in this image: {result.get(&#x27;found_years', [])}") # Show the specific pattern matches "keyword">for the latest year "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): latest_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in result[&#x27;pattern_matches'] "keyword">if m['year'] == latest_overall_year] "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_matches: print(f" Match context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Pattern type: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print() # Show detailed breakdown by image print(f"üìã DETAILED BREAKDOWN BY IMAGE:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;found_years'): print(f"\n Image {result[&#x27;image_number']} ({result.get('image_filename', 'N/A')}):") print(f" Years found: {result[&#x27;found_years']}") print(f" Latest year: {result.get(&#x27;latest_year')}") print(f" Text length: {result.get(&#x27;extracted_text_length', 0)} characters") "keyword">if result.get(&#x27;pattern_matches'): print(f" Pattern chronological years found "keyword">in any images") print(f"\nüìã OCR EXTRACTION RESULTS:") "keyword">for result "keyword">in image_analysis_results: print(f"\n Image {result[&#x27;image_number']} "keyword">not result.get(&#x27;ocr_success', "keyword">False): print(f" Failure reason: {result.get(&#x27;ocr_failure_reason', 'Unknown')}") "keyword">else: text_preview = result.get(&#x27;extracted_text', '')[:100] print(f" Text preview: &#x27;{text_preview}...'") # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': thieme_becker_url, &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;total_images_found': &#x27;unique_years': sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': max(all_years_found) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;earliest_year': min(all_years_found) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(all_years_found), &#x27;unique_years_count': len(set(all_years_found)) "keyword">if all_years_found "keyword">else 0, &#x27;images_with_years': len([r "keyword">for r "keyword">in image_analysis_results "keyword">if r.get('found_years')]), &#x27;pattern_matches': all_pattern_matches } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_corrected_image_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: ANALYSIS\n") f.write(f"={"="*75}\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Source URL: {thieme_becker_url}\n") f.write(f"Page Title: page") print(f"üìä Images processed: {len(image_analysis_results)}") print(f"üìä Successful downloads: {successful_downloads}") print(f"üìä Successful OCR: {successful_ocr}") print(f"\nüìÅ All üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== RESUMING THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS - COMPLETING OCR EXTRACTION ===") print("Objective: Complete the interrupted image download "keyword">and OCR analysis "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Check workspace structure "keyword">and find the correct workspace workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: # Sort by modification time to get the most recent workspace_dirs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: os.path.getmtime(x), reverse="keyword">True) workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using most recent workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # Check what files exist "keyword">in the workspace print(f"\nWorkspace contents:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(" (empty "keyword">or doesn&#x27;t exist)") # Load the saved HTML file to "keyword">continue analysis html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(html_file): print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file "keyword">not found - need to re-download") # Re-download the page thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker" headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Re-downloading Thieme-Becker page: {thieme_becker_url}") response = requests.get(thieme_becker_url, headers=headers, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"‚úÖ Page re-downloaded "keyword">and saved ({len(response.content):,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to re-download page: HTTP {response.status_code}") exit() "keyword">else: print(f"Found existing HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)") # Load "keyword">and parse the HTML "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title').get_text().strip() "keyword">if soup.find('title') "keyword">else 'Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;body') "keyword">or soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract "keyword">and identify the content image (the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker lexicon image) print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING THE CONTENT IMAGE ===") all_images = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Found {len(all_images)} total images on the page") # Find the specific content image we need to analyze content_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') classes = img.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', []) width = img.get(&#x27;width', '') height = img.get(&#x27;height', '') print(f"\nImage {i}:") print(f" Source: {src}") print(f" Classes: {classes}") print(f" Dimensions: {width} x {height}") # Identify the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker content image "keyword">if &#x27;thumbimage' "keyword">in classes "keyword">and 'Perwanger' "keyword">in src: content_image = { &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;width': width, &#x27;height': height, &#x27;"keyword">class': classes, &#x27;full_element': str(img) } print(f" ‚úÖ IDENTIFIED AS CONTENT IMAGE - Contains Thieme-Becker lexicon content") "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f" ‚ùå Skipping - Not the target content image") "keyword">if "keyword">not content_image: print("‚ùå Could "keyword">not find the Thieme-Becker content image") exit() print(f"\n=== CONTENT IMAGE DETAILS ===") print(f"Image source: {content_image[&#x27;src']}") print(f"Dimensions: {content_image[&#x27;width']} x {content_image['height']}") print(f"Classes: {content_image[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") # Download the content image print(f"\n=== DOWNLOADING CONTENT IMAGE ===") img_src = content_image[&#x27;src'] # Handle the archived URL format "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src print(f"Full image URL: {img_src}") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9' } "keyword">try: print(f"Downloading image...") img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if img_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)") # Save the image img_filename = "thieme_becker_lexicon_page.jpg" img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename) "keyword">with open(img_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(img_response.content) print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}") # Analyze the image "keyword">for text content using OCR print(f"\n=== OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing extracted text "keyword">for chronological years...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year}") print(f" Pattern: {description}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") print() "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years print(f"üîç Searching "keyword">for Roman numerals...") roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) roman_numerals_found = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long roman_numerals_found.append(roman_numeral) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 20) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 20) context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral}") print(f" Context: &#x27;{context.strip()}'") # Analyze results print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") "keyword">if found_years: sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) latest_year = max(found_years) earliest_year = min(found_years) print(f"üìä CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Total years found: {len(found_years)}") print(f" Year range: {earliest_year} - {latest_year}") print(f" All years: {sorted_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Find the context "keyword">for the latest year latest_year_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">if latest_year_matches: print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) CONTEXT:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_year_matches: print(f" Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match['match_text']}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Position: {match[&#x27;position']}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in the extracted text") latest_year = "keyword">None # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{content_image['width']}x{content_image['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': content_image['"keyword">class'] }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;earliest_year': min(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;roman_numerals_found': roman_numerals_found } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes") # Save extracted text separately "keyword">for easy review text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;extracted_text_from_image.txt') "keyword">with open(text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"EXTRACTED TEXT FROM THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*60}\n\n") f.write(f"Image: {img_filename}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") f.write(f"RAW EXTRACTED TEXT:\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;-'*40}\n") f.write(extracted_text) f.write(f"\n{&#x27;-'*40}\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"\nCHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR: {latest_year}\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"\nNo chronological years found.\n") print(f"‚úÖ Extracted text saved to: {os.path.basename(text_file)}") # Create summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;final_analysis_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE - CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*70}\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\n") f.write(f"- Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"- Latest year: {latest_year}\n") f.write(f"- Earliest year: {min(found_years)}\n") f.write(f"- Total years: {len(found_years)}\n\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) DETAILS:\n") latest_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_matches: f.write(f"- Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}\n") f.write(f"- Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'\n") f.write(f"- Position: {match[&#x27;position']}\n\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found\n") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image (OCR returned empty result)") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") print(f"Cannot proceed "keyword">with text extraction "keyword">from image") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as
