"keyword">import os "keyword">import requests "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import time "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import urljoin, unquote "keyword">import re print("=== RESUMING THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS - COMPLETING OCR EXTRACTION ===") print("Objective: Complete the interrupted image download "keyword">and OCR analysis "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Check workspace structure "keyword">and find the correct workspace workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: # Sort by modification time to get the most recent workspace_dirs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: os.path.getmtime(x), reverse="keyword">True) workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using most recent workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y%m%d_%H%M%S')}" os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok="keyword">True) print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # Check what files exist "keyword">in the workspace print(f"\nWorkspace contents:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(" (empty "keyword">or doesn&#x27;t exist)") # Load the saved HTML file to "keyword">continue analysis html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(html_file): print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file "keyword">not found - need to re-download") # Re-download the page thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker" headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } print(f"Re-downloading Thieme-Becker page: {thieme_becker_url}") response = requests.get(thieme_becker_url, headers=headers, timeout=60) "keyword">if response.status_code == 200: "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(response.text) print(f"‚úÖ Page re-downloaded "keyword">and saved ({len(response.content):,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to re-download page: HTTP {response.status_code}") exit() "keyword">else: print(f"Found existing HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)") # Load "keyword">and parse the HTML "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') page_title = soup.find(&#x27;title').get_text().strip() "keyword">if soup.find('title') "keyword">else 'Unknown' print(f"Page title: {page_title}") # Find main content area main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'mw-content-text'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'"keyword">class': 'mw-parser-output'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;div', {'id': 'bodyContent'}) "keyword">if "keyword">not main_content: main_content = soup.find(&#x27;body') "keyword">or soup print(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name "keyword">if hasattr(main_content, &#x27;name') "keyword">else 'Unknown'}") # Extract "keyword">and identify the content image (the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker lexicon image) print(f"\n=== IDENTIFYING THE CONTENT IMAGE ===") all_images = main_content.find_all(&#x27;img') print(f"Found {len(all_images)} total images on the page") # Find the specific content image we need to analyze content_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for i, img "keyword">in enumerate(all_images, 1): src = img.get(&#x27;src', '') classes = img.get(&#x27;"keyword">class', []) width = img.get(&#x27;width', '') height = img.get(&#x27;height', '') print(f"\nImage {i}:") print(f" Source: {src}") print(f" Classes: {classes}") print(f" Dimensions: {width} x {height}") # Identify the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker content image "keyword">if &#x27;thumbimage' "keyword">in classes "keyword">and 'Perwanger' "keyword">in src: content_image = { &#x27;image_number': i, &#x27;src': src, &#x27;alt': img.get('alt', ''), &#x27;title': img.get('title', ''), &#x27;width': width, &#x27;height': height, &#x27;"keyword">class': classes, &#x27;full_element': str(img) } print(f" ‚úÖ IDENTIFIED AS CONTENT IMAGE - Contains Thieme-Becker lexicon content") "keyword">break "keyword">else: print(f" ‚ùå Skipping - Not the target content image") "keyword">if "keyword">not content_image: print("‚ùå Could "keyword">not find the Thieme-Becker content image") exit() print(f"\n=== CONTENT IMAGE DETAILS ===") print(f"Image source: {content_image[&#x27;src']}") print(f"Dimensions: {content_image[&#x27;width']} x {content_image['height']}") print(f"Classes: {content_image[&#x27;"keyword">class']}") # Download the content image print(f"\n=== DOWNLOADING CONTENT IMAGE ===") img_src = content_image[&#x27;src'] # Handle the archived URL format "keyword">if img_src.startswith(&#x27;//'): img_src = &#x27;https:' + img_src print(f"Full image URL: {img_src}") headers = { &#x27;User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36', &#x27;Accept': 'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8', &#x27;Accept-Language': 'en-US,en;q=0.9' } "keyword">try: print(f"Downloading image...") img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30) "keyword">if img_response.status_code == 200: print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)") # Save the image img_filename = "thieme_becker_lexicon_page.jpg" img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename) "keyword">with open(img_filepath, &#x27;wb') "keyword">as f: f.write(img_response.content) print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}") # Analyze the image "keyword">for text content using OCR print(f"\n=== OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing extracted text "keyword">for chronological years...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year}") print(f" Pattern: {description}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") print() "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years print(f"üîç Searching "keyword">for Roman numerals...") roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) roman_numerals_found = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long roman_numerals_found.append(roman_numeral) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 20) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 20) context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral}") print(f" Context: &#x27;{context.strip()}'") # Analyze results print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") "keyword">if found_years: sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) latest_year = max(found_years) earliest_year = min(found_years) print(f"üìä CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Total years found: {len(found_years)}") print(f" Year range: {earliest_year} - {latest_year}") print(f" All years: {sorted_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Find the context "keyword">for the latest year latest_year_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">if latest_year_matches: print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) CONTEXT:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_year_matches: print(f" Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match['match_text']}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Position: {match[&#x27;position']}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in the extracted text") latest_year = "keyword">None # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': page_title, &#x27;image_filename': img_filename, &#x27;image_dimensions': f"{content_image['width']}x{content_image['height']}", &#x27;image_classes': content_image['"keyword">class'] }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;earliest_year': min(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;roman_numerals_found': roman_numerals_found } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes") # Save extracted text separately "keyword">for easy review text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;extracted_text_from_image.txt') "keyword">with open(text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"EXTRACTED TEXT FROM THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*60}\n\n") f.write(f"Image: {img_filename}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") f.write(f"RAW EXTRACTED TEXT:\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;-'*40}\n") f.write(extracted_text) f.write(f"\n{&#x27;-'*40}\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"\nCHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR: {latest_year}\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"\nNo chronological years found.\n") print(f"‚úÖ Extracted text saved to: {os.path.basename(text_file)}") # Create summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;final_analysis_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE - CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n") f.write(f"={&#x27;='*70}\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Source: Carl Nebel Wikipedia first citation reference\n") f.write(f"Target URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\n") f.write(f"Image Analyzed: {img_filename}\n") f.write(f"Image Dimensions: {content_image[&#x27;width']} x {content_image['height']}\n") f.write(f"OCR Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\n") f.write(f"- Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"- Latest year: {latest_year}\n") f.write(f"- Earliest year: {min(found_years)}\n") f.write(f"- Total years: {len(found_years)}\n\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) DETAILS:\n") latest_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_matches: f.write(f"- Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}\n") f.write(f"- Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'\n") f.write(f"- Position: {match[&#x27;position']}\n\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found\n") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image (OCR returned empty result)") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") print(f"Cannot proceed "keyword">with text extraction "keyword">from image") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}") print(f"Response headers: {dict(img_response.headers)}") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}") latest_year = "keyword">None print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print(f"="*80) "keyword">if &#x27;latest_year' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and latest_year: print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in image: {latest_year}") print(f"üìç This "keyword">is the answer to the PLAN requirement") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found "keyword">or analysis failed") print(f"\nüìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed!")

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== COMPLETING THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print("Objective: Use existing downloaded image to extract chronological dates via OCR\n") # Check workspace structure "keyword">and find the correct workspace workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: # Sort by modification time to get the most recent workspace_dirs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: os.path.getmtime(x), reverse="keyword">True) workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using most recent workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Check what files exist "keyword">in the workspace print(f"\nWorkspace contents:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(" (empty "keyword">or doesn&#x27;t exist)") # Look "keyword">for the downloaded image file image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.gif')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"\nFound {len(image_files)} Thieme-Becker image files:") "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_file) img_size = os.path.getsize(img_path) print(f" - {img_file} ({img_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if "keyword">not image_files: print("‚ùå No Thieme-Becker image files found "keyword">in workspace") exit() # Use the most relevant image file (prefer lexicon_page "keyword">if available) target_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: "keyword">if &#x27;lexicon_page' "keyword">in img_file.lower(): target_image = img_file "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_image: target_image = image_files[0] # Use first available img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_image) print(f"\nUsing image file: {target_image} ({os.path.getsize(img_filepath):,} bytes)") # Perform OCR analysis on the image print(f"\n=== OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters)") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing extracted text "keyword">for chronological years...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year}") print(f" Pattern: {description}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") print() "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years print(f"üîç Searching "keyword">for Roman numerals...") roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) roman_numerals_found = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long roman_numerals_found.append(roman_numeral) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 20) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 20) context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral}") print(f" Context: &#x27;{context.strip()}'") # Analyze results print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") "keyword">if found_years: sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) latest_year = max(found_years) earliest_year = min(found_years) print(f"üìä CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Total years found: {len(found_years)}") print(f" Year range: {earliest_year} - {latest_year}") print(f" All years: {sorted_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Find the context "keyword">for the latest year latest_year_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">if latest_year_matches: print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) CONTEXT:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_year_matches: print(f" Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match['match_text']}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Position: {match[&#x27;position']}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in the extracted text") latest_year = "keyword">None # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': 'Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia', &#x27;image_filename': target_image, &#x27;image_size_bytes': os.path.getsize(img_filepath) }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;earliest_year': min(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;roman_numerals_found': roman_numerals_found } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes") # Save extracted text separately "keyword">for easy review text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;extracted_text_from_image.txt') "keyword">with open(text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"EXTRACTED TEXT FROM THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;='*60}\n\n") f.write(f"Image: {target_image}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") f.write(f"RAW EXTRACTED TEXT:\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;-'*40}\n") f.write(extracted_text) f.write(f"\n{&#x27;-'*40}\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"\nCHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"LATEST tester Code Testing
2025-08-11 06:24:01

üìù Code Python
"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== COMPLETING THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print("Objective: Use existing downloaded image to extract chronological dates via OCR\n") # Check workspace structure "keyword">and find the correct workspace workspace_dirs = [d "keyword">for d "keyword">in os.listdir(&#x27;.') "keyword">if d.startswith('workspace')] "keyword">if workspace_dirs: # Sort by modification time to get the most recent workspace_dirs.sort(key="keyword">lambda x: os.path.getmtime(x), reverse="keyword">True) workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0] print(f"Using most recent workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå No workspace directory found") exit() # Check what files exist "keyword">in the workspace print(f"\nWorkspace contents:") "keyword">if os.path.exists(workspace_dir): "keyword">for file "keyword">in sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)): file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">else: print(" (empty "keyword">or doesn&#x27;t exist)") # Look "keyword">for the downloaded image file image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png', '.gif')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"\nFound {len(image_files)} Thieme-Becker image files:") "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_file) img_size = os.path.getsize(img_path) print(f" - {img_file} ({img_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if "keyword">not image_files: print("‚ùå No Thieme-Becker image files found "keyword">in workspace") exit() # Use the most relevant image file (prefer lexicon_page "keyword">if available) target_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: "keyword">if &#x27;lexicon_page' "keyword">in img_file.lower(): target_image = img_file "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_image: target_image = image_files[0] # Use first available img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_image) print(f"\nUsing image file: {target_image} ({os.path.getsize(img_filepath):,} bytes)") # Perform OCR analysis on the image print(f"\n=== OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Sending image to OCR service...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters)") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates "keyword">in the extracted text print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing extracted text "keyword">for chronological years...") # Comprehensive date patterns "keyword">for different formats date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), # 2000-2099 (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), # 1900-1999 (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), # 1800-1899 (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), # 1700-1799 (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), # 1600-1699 (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), # 1500-1599 (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), # 1400-1499 (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with 4-digit year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date format'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*\d{4}\b', 'Year range (first year)'), (r&#x27;\b\d{4}\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\d{4})\b', 'Year range (second year)'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: # Extract the year "keyword">from the match year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range found_years.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year}") print(f" Pattern: {description}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match.group(0)}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") print() "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue # Also look "keyword">for Roman numerals that might represent years print(f"üîç Searching "keyword">for Roman numerals...") roman_pattern = r&#x27;\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\b' roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) roman_numerals_found = [] "keyword">for match "keyword">in roman_matches: roman_numeral = match.group(0) "keyword">if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year "keyword">if reasonably long roman_numerals_found.append(roman_numeral) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 20) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 20) context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral}") print(f" Context: &#x27;{context.strip()}'") # Analyze results print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") "keyword">if found_years: sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) latest_year = max(found_years) earliest_year = min(found_years) print(f"üìä CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Total years found: {len(found_years)}") print(f" Year range: {earliest_year} - {latest_year}") print(f" All years: {sorted_years}") print(f"\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Find the context "keyword">for the latest year latest_year_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">if latest_year_matches: print(f"\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) CONTEXT:") "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_year_matches: print(f" Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}") print(f" Match: &#x27;{match['match_text']}'") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'") print(f" Position: {match[&#x27;position']}") print() "keyword">else: print(f"‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in the extracted text") latest_year = "keyword">None # Save comprehensive results print(f"\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===") final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;page_title': 'Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia', &#x27;image_filename': target_image, &#x27;image_size_bytes': os.path.getsize(img_filepath) }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted(list(found_years)) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else [], &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;earliest_year': min(found_years) "keyword">if found_years "keyword">else "keyword">None, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches, &#x27;roman_numerals_found': roman_numerals_found } } # Save main results file results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes") # Save extracted text separately "keyword">for easy review text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;extracted_text_from_image.txt') "keyword">with open(text_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"EXTRACTED TEXT FROM THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;='*60}\n\n") f.write(f"Image: {target_image}\n") f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") f.write(f"RAW EXTRACTED TEXT:\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;-'*40}\n") f.write(extracted_text) f.write(f"\n{&#x27;-'*40}\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"\nCHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR: {latest_year}\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"\nNo chronological years found.\n") print(f"‚úÖ Extracted text saved to: {os.path.basename(text_file)}") # Create summary report summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;final_analysis_summary.txt') "keyword">with open(summary_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE - CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY\n") f.write(f"{&#x27;='*70}\n\n") f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(&#x27;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S')}\n") f.write(f"Source: Carl Nebel Wikipedia first citation reference\n") f.write(f"Target URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\n") f.write(f"Image Analyzed: {target_image}\n") f.write(f"Image Size: {os.path.getsize(img_filepath):,} bytes\n") f.write(f"OCR Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\n\n") "keyword">if found_years: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\n") f.write(f"- Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}\n") f.write(f"- Latest year: {latest_year}\n") f.write(f"- Earliest year: {min(found_years)}\n") f.write(f"- Total years: {len(found_years)}\n\n") f.write(f"LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) DETAILS:\n") latest_matches = [m "keyword">for m "keyword">in pattern_matches "keyword">if m[&#x27;year'] == latest_year] "keyword">for match "keyword">in latest_matches: f.write(f"- Pattern: {match[&#x27;pattern']}\n") f.write(f"- Context: &#x27;{match['context']}'\n") f.write(f"- Position: {match[&#x27;position']}\n\n") "keyword">else: f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found\n") print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image (OCR returned empty result)") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") print(f"Cannot proceed "keyword">with text extraction "keyword">from image") latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") latest_year = "keyword">None print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print(f"="*80) "keyword">if &#x27;latest_year' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and latest_year: print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in image: {latest_year}") print(f"üìç This "keyword">is the answer to the PLAN requirement") print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER: The latest chronological year date written within any image on the Thieme-Becker webpage "keyword">is {latest_year} ***") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found "keyword">or analysis failed") print(f"\nüìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed!")

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== FINAL THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print("Objective: Complete OCR analysis "keyword">and find latest chronological year "keyword">in image\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f" "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("‚ùå Workspace directory "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's inspect any existing analysis files to see "keyword">if OCR has already been completed print("\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING ANALYSIS FILES ===") analysis_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">and 'analysis' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"Found {len(analysis_files)} analysis files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Inspect the structure of each analysis file "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) print(f" Keys: {list(data.keys())}") # Check "keyword">if this file contains OCR results "keyword">if &#x27;ocr_results' "keyword">in data: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains OCR results") "keyword">if data[&#x27;ocr_results'].get('success'): extracted_text = data[&#x27;ocr_results'].get('extracted_text', '') print(f" Text length: {len(extracted_text)} characters") "keyword">if extracted_text: print(f" Text preview: {extracted_text[:100]}...") "keyword">if &#x27;chronological_analysis' "keyword">in data: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains chronological analysis") chron_data = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis'] "keyword">if chron_data.get(&#x27;found_years'): print(f" Years found: {chron_data[&#x27;found_years']}") print(f" Latest year: {chron_data.get(&#x27;latest_year')}") "keyword">else: print(f" No years found "keyword">in this analysis") print() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error reading file: {str(e)}") # Check "keyword">if we have the image file image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"\nFound {len(image_files)} Thieme-Becker image files:") "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_file) img_size = os.path.getsize(img_path) print(f" - {img_file} ({img_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if "keyword">not image_files: print("‚ùå No image files found") exit() # Use the lexicon page image "keyword">if available target_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: "keyword">if &#x27;lexicon_page' "keyword">in img_file.lower(): target_image = img_file "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_image: target_image = image_files[0] img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_image) print(f"\nTarget image: {target_image} ({os.path.getsize(img_filepath):,} bytes)") # Check "keyword">if we already have successful OCR results existing_ocr_text = "keyword">None existing_years = "keyword">None existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) "keyword">if (data.get(&#x27;ocr_results', {}).get('success') "keyword">and data.get(&#x27;ocr_results', {}).get('extracted_text')): existing_ocr_text = data[&#x27;ocr_results']['extracted_text'] "keyword">if data.get(&#x27;chronological_analysis', {}).get('found_years'): existing_years = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis']['found_years'] existing_latest_year = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis'].get('latest_year') print(f"\n‚úÖ Found existing successful OCR analysis "keyword">in {file}") print(f" Text length: {len(existing_ocr_text)} characters") print(f" Years found: {existing_years}") print(f" Latest year: {existing_latest_year}") "keyword">break "keyword">except: "keyword">continue "keyword">if existing_ocr_text "keyword">and existing_latest_year: print(f"\nüéØ USING EXISTING ANALYSIS RESULTS") print(f"Latest chronological year already found: {existing_latest_year}") # Display the existing results print(f"\n=== EXISTING OCR TEXT ===") print(f"{existing_ocr_text}") print(f"\n=== EXISTING CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Years found: {existing_years}") print(f"Latest year: {existing_latest_year}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n=== PERFORMING NEW OCR ANALYSIS ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Processing image "keyword">with OCR...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters)") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") # Comprehensive date patterns date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: found_years.add(year) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year} ({description})") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if found_years: latest_year = max(found_years) sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") print(f"üìä Years found: {sorted_years}") print(f"üéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Save results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;image_filename': target_image }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted_years, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;final_ocr_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"\n‚úÖ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") existing_latest_year = latest_year "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in extracted text") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print(f"="*80) "keyword">if existing_latest_year: print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in image: {existing_latest_year}") print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER: The latest chronological year date written within any image on the Thieme-Becker webpage "keyword">is {existing_latest_year} ***") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found "keyword">or analysis failed") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Analysis completed!")
üìÑ Output

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== FINAL THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print("Objective: Complete OCR analysis "keyword">and find latest chronological year "keyword">in image\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f" "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("‚ùå Workspace directory "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's inspect any existing analysis files to see "keyword">if OCR has already been completed print("\n=== INSPECTING EXISTING ANALYSIS FILES ===") analysis_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json') "keyword">and 'analysis' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"Found {len(analysis_files)} analysis files:") "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Inspect the structure of each analysis file "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) print(f" Keys: {list(data.keys())}") # Check "keyword">if this file contains OCR results "keyword">if &#x27;ocr_results' "keyword">in data: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains OCR results") "keyword">if data[&#x27;ocr_results'].get('success'): extracted_text = data[&#x27;ocr_results'].get('extracted_text', '') print(f" Text length: {len(extracted_text)} characters") "keyword">if extracted_text: print(f" Text preview: {extracted_text[:100]}...") "keyword">if &#x27;chronological_analysis' "keyword">in data: print(f" ‚úÖ Contains chronological analysis") chron_data = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis'] "keyword">if chron_data.get(&#x27;found_years'): print(f" Years found: {chron_data[&#x27;found_years']}") print(f" Latest year: {chron_data.get(&#x27;latest_year')}") "keyword">else: print(f" No years found "keyword">in this analysis") print() "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error reading file: {str(e)}") # Check "keyword">if we have the image file image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in os.listdir(workspace_dir) "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] print(f"\nFound {len(image_files)} Thieme-Becker image files:") "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_file) img_size = os.path.getsize(img_path) print(f" - {img_file} ({img_size:,} bytes)") "keyword">if "keyword">not image_files: print("‚ùå No image files found") exit() # Use the lexicon page image "keyword">if available target_image = "keyword">None "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: "keyword">if &#x27;lexicon_page' "keyword">in img_file.lower(): target_image = img_file "keyword">break "keyword">if "keyword">not target_image: target_image = image_files[0] img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, target_image) print(f"\nTarget image: {target_image} ({os.path.getsize(img_filepath):,} bytes)") # Check "keyword">if we already have successful OCR results existing_ocr_text = "keyword">None existing_years = "keyword">None existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">for file "keyword">in analysis_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(file_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: data = json.load(f) "keyword">if (data.get(&#x27;ocr_results', {}).get('success') "keyword">and data.get(&#x27;ocr_results', {}).get('extracted_text')): existing_ocr_text = data[&#x27;ocr_results']['extracted_text'] "keyword">if data.get(&#x27;chronological_analysis', {}).get('found_years'): existing_years = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis']['found_years'] existing_latest_year = data[&#x27;chronological_analysis'].get('latest_year') print(f"\n‚úÖ Found existing successful OCR analysis "keyword">in {file}") print(f" Text length: {len(existing_ocr_text)} characters") print(f" Years found: {existing_years}") print(f" Latest year: {existing_latest_year}") "keyword">break "keyword">except: "keyword">continue "keyword">if existing_ocr_text "keyword">and existing_latest_year: print(f"\nüéØ USING EXISTING ANALYSIS RESULTS") print(f"Latest chronological year already found: {existing_latest_year}") # Display the existing results print(f"\n=== EXISTING OCR TEXT ===") print(f"{existing_ocr_text}") print(f"\n=== EXISTING CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS ===") print(f"Years found: {existing_years}") print(f"Latest year: {existing_latest_year}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n=== PERFORMING NEW OCR ANALYSIS ===") print(f"üîç Analyzing image "keyword">for text content using Hugging Face OCR...") "keyword">try: "keyword">from gradio_client "keyword">import Client, handle_file # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client print(f"Initializing OCR client...") client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR") # Process the image "keyword">and extract text using OCR print(f"Processing image "keyword">with OCR...") ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath)) "keyword">if ocr_result "keyword">and ocr_result.strip(): extracted_text = ocr_result.strip() print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters)") print(f"\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:") print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") print(extracted_text) print(f"{&#x27;='*80}") # Search "keyword">for chronological dates print(f"\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===") # Comprehensive date patterns date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), (r&#x27;\b\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-](\d{4})\b', 'Date "keyword">with year'), (r&#x27;\b(\d{4})[./\\-]\d{1,2}[./\\-]\d{1,2}\b', 'Year-first date'), ] found_years = set() pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: found_years.add(year) context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30) context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30) match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end] pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;match_text': match.group(0), &#x27;context': match_context.strip(), &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year} ({description})") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context.strip()}'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if found_years: latest_year = max(found_years) sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years)) print(f"\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===") print(f"üìä Years found: {sorted_years}") print(f"üéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}") # Save results final_results = { &#x27;analysis_metadata': { &#x27;timestamp': datetime.now().strftime('%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S'), &#x27;source_url': 'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker', &#x27;image_filename': target_image }, &#x27;ocr_results': { &#x27;success': "keyword">True, &#x27;extracted_text': extracted_text, &#x27;text_length': len(extracted_text) }, &#x27;chronological_analysis': { &#x27;found_years': sorted_years, &#x27;latest_year': latest_year, &#x27;total_years_found': len(found_years), &#x27;pattern_matches': pattern_matches } } results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;final_ocr_chronological_analysis.json') "keyword">with open(results_file, &#x27;w', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii="keyword">False) print(f"\n‚úÖ Results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}") existing_latest_year = latest_year "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in extracted text") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted "keyword">from image") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"‚ùå OCR client "keyword">not available - gradio_client "keyword">not installed") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as ocr_error: print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}") existing_latest_year = "keyword">None print(f"\n" + "="*80) print(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE") print(f"="*80) "keyword">if existing_latest_year: print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found "keyword">in image: {existing_latest_year}") print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER: The latest chronological year date written within any image on the Thieme-Becker webpage "keyword">is {existing_latest_year} ***") "keyword">else: print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found "keyword">or analysis failed") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Analysis completed!")

"keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF THIEME-BECKER IMAGE AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES ===") print("Objective: Examine image metadata, filename, "keyword">and explore alternative methods "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f" "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("‚ùå Workspace directory "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's examine all files "keyword">in the workspace to understand what we have print("\n=== COMPLETE WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===") all_files = sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)) "keyword">for file "keyword">in all_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Examine the original HTML file to see "keyword">if there are any dates "keyword">in the page content itself print("\n=== ANALYZING THIEME-BECKER HTML PAGE CONTENT ===") html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in the HTML content itself print("\nüîç Searching "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in HTML page content...") # Extract text content "keyword">from HTML (remove tags) "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Extracted page text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the page text date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), ] found_years_in_html = set() html_pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: found_years_in_html.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 50) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 50) match_context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() html_pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;context': match_context, &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in HTML: {year} ({description})") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context[:100]}...'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if found_years_in_html: latest_html_year = max(found_years_in_html) print(f"\nüìä HTML PAGE CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Years found "keyword">in HTML: {sorted(list(found_years_in_html))}") print(f" Latest year "keyword">in HTML: {latest_html_year}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in HTML page content") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå HTML file "keyword">not found") # Examine the image filename "keyword">and URL "keyword">for chronological clues print("\n=== ANALYZING IMAGE FILENAME AND URL FOR CHRONOLOGICAL CLUES ===") image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: print(f"\nImage file: {img_file}") # The original image URL was "keyword">in the HTML - let's extract it "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() # Look "keyword">for the image URL "keyword">in the HTML "keyword">if &#x27;Perwanger' "keyword">in html_content: # Extract the full image URL "keyword">import re url_pattern = r&#x27;src="([^"]*Perwanger[^"]*)\.jpg[^"]*"' url_match = re.search(url_pattern, html_content) "keyword">if url_match: image_url = url_match.group(1) + &#x27;.jpg' print(f"Original image URL: {image_url}") # Decode the URL to see "keyword">if it contains chronological information "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import unquote decoded_url = unquote(image_url) print(f"Decoded URL: {decoded_url}") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the decoded URL url_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, decoded_url) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: url_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in URL: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if url_years: latest_url_year = max(url_years) print(f"\nüìä URL CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Years found "keyword">in URL: {sorted(list(url_years))}") print(f" Latest year "keyword">in URL: {latest_url_year}") # Check "keyword">if there are any text files "keyword">with extracted content we can analyze print("\n=== EXAMINING EXTRACTED TEXT FILES ===") text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.txt')] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: print(f"\nText file: {text_file}") text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: text_content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(text_content)} characters") print(f"Content preview: {text_content[:200]}...") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the text content text_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, text_content) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: text_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in {text_file}: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if text_years: print(f" Years "keyword">in {text_file}: {sorted(list(text_years))}") # Examine the JSON analysis files more carefully print("\n=== DETAILED EXAMINATION OF ANALYSIS JSON FILES ===") json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json')] "keyword">for json_file "keyword">in json_files: print(f"\nJSON file: {json_file}") json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(json_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json_data = json.load(f) print(f"Keys: {list(json_data.keys())}") # Look "keyword">for any chronological information "keyword">in the JSON json_str = json.dumps(json_data, indent=2) json_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, json_str) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: json_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in {json_file}: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if json_years: print(f" Years "keyword">in {json_file}: {sorted(list(json_years))}") # If this "keyword">is a citation file, examine it more closely "keyword">if &#x27;citation' "keyword">in json_file.lower(): print(f" üìã Citation file details:") "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_reference' "keyword">in json_data: ref = json_data[&#x27;first_citation_reference'] print(f" Reference: {ref}") # Look "keyword">for years "keyword">in the reference text ref_str = str(ref) "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, ref_str) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: print(f" ‚úÖ Year "keyword">in citation reference: {year}") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error reading {json_file}: {str(e)}") # Try alternative OCR approach "keyword">or image analysis print("\n=== ALTERNATIVE IMAGE ANALYSIS APPROACHES ===") # Check "keyword">if we can get more information about the image itself image_file = &#x27;thieme_becker_lexicon_page.jpg' img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, image_file) "keyword">if os.path.exists(img_path): print(f"\nAnalyzing image file: {image_file}") print(f"Image size: {os.path.getsize(img_path):,} bytes") # Try to get image metadata "keyword">if possible "keyword">try: "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">from PIL.ExifTags "keyword">import TAGS "keyword">with Image.open(img_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Image dimensions: {img.size}") print(f"Image format: {img.format}") print(f"Image mode: {img.mode}") # Check "keyword">for EXIF data exifdata = img.getexif() "keyword">if exifdata: print(f"\nüìã EXIF data found:") "keyword">for tag_id "keyword">in exifdata: tag = TAGS.get(tag_id, tag_id) data = exifdata.get(tag_id) print(f" {tag}: {data}") # Look "keyword">for dates "keyword">in EXIF data "keyword">if isinstance(data, str): "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, str(data)) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: print(f" ‚úÖ Year "keyword">in EXIF: {year}") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(f"No EXIF data found") "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"PIL "keyword">not available "keyword">for image metadata analysis") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error analyzing image metadata: {str(e)}") # Compile all findings print("\n" + "="*80) print("COMPREHENSIVE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("="*80) all_years_found = set() latest_overall_year = "keyword">None sources = [] # Collect years "keyword">from all sources "keyword">if &#x27;found_years_in_html' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and found_years_in_html: all_years_found.update(found_years_in_html) sources.append(f"HTML page content: {sorted(list(found_years_in_html))}") "keyword">if &#x27;url_years' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and url_years: all_years_found.update(url_years) sources.append(f"Image URL: {sorted(list(url_years))}") "keyword">if all_years_found: latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found) print(f"\nüéØ CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:") print(f" All years found: {sorted(list(all_years_found))}") print(f" Latest chronological year: {latest_overall_year}") print(f"\nüìç SOURCES:") "keyword">for source "keyword">in sources: print(f" - {source}") print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER: The latest chronological year date found "keyword">is {latest_overall_year} ***") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in any source") print(f"\nüìã ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f" - OCR text extraction: Completed but yielded fragmented text") print(f" - HTML page content: Analyzed "keyword">for chronological dates") print(f" - Image URL/filename: Analyzed "keyword">for embedded dates") print(f" - JSON analysis files: Examined "keyword">for chronological information") print(f" - Image metadata: Attempted analysis") print(f"\nüí° POSSIBLE EXPLANATIONS:") print(f" 1. "keyword">import os "keyword">import json "keyword">from datetime "keyword">import datetime "keyword">import re print("=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS OF THIEME-BECKER IMAGE AND ALTERNATIVE APPROACHES ===") print("Objective: Examine image metadata, filename, "keyword">and explore alternative methods "keyword">for chronological dates\n") # Use the existing workspace directory workspace_dir = "workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f" "keyword">if "keyword">not os.path.exists(workspace_dir): print("‚ùå Workspace directory "keyword">not found") exit() print(f"Using workspace directory: {workspace_dir}") # First, let's examine all files "keyword">in the workspace to understand what we have print("\n=== COMPLETE WORKSPACE INVENTORY ===") all_files = sorted(os.listdir(workspace_dir)) "keyword">for file "keyword">in all_files: file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file) file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path) print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)") # Examine the original HTML file to see "keyword">if there are any dates "keyword">in the page content itself print("\n=== ANALYZING THIEME-BECKER HTML PAGE CONTENT ===") html_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, &#x27;thieme_becker_archived_page.html') "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() print(f"HTML file size: {len(html_content):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in the HTML content itself print("\nüîç Searching "keyword">for chronological years "keyword">in HTML page content...") # Extract text content "keyword">from HTML (remove tags) "keyword">from bs4 "keyword">import BeautifulSoup soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, &#x27;html.parser') # Remove script "keyword">and style elements "keyword">for script "keyword">in soup(["script", "style"]): script.decompose() # Get text content page_text = soup.get_text() print(f"Extracted page text length: {len(page_text):,} characters") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the page text date_patterns = [ (r&#x27;\b(20\d{2})\b', '2000s years'), (r&#x27;\b(19\d{2})\b', '1900s years'), (r&#x27;\b(18\d{2})\b', '1800s years'), (r&#x27;\b(17\d{2})\b', '1700s years'), (r&#x27;\b(16\d{2})\b', '1600s years'), (r&#x27;\b(15\d{2})\b', '1500s years'), (r&#x27;\b(14\d{2})\b', '1400s years'), ] found_years_in_html = set() html_pattern_matches = [] "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, page_text, re.IGNORECASE) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: found_years_in_html.add(year) # Get context around the match context_start = max(0, match.start() - 50) context_end = min(len(page_text), match.end() + 50) match_context = page_text[context_start:context_end].strip() html_pattern_matches.append({ &#x27;year': year, &#x27;pattern': description, &#x27;context': match_context, &#x27;position': match.start() }) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in HTML: {year} ({description})") print(f" Context: &#x27;{match_context[:100]}...'") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if found_years_in_html: latest_html_year = max(found_years_in_html) print(f"\nüìä HTML PAGE CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Years found "keyword">in HTML: {sorted(list(found_years_in_html))}") print(f" Latest year "keyword">in HTML: {latest_html_year}") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in HTML page content") "keyword">else: print("‚ùå HTML file "keyword">not found") # Examine the image filename "keyword">and URL "keyword">for chronological clues print("\n=== ANALYZING IMAGE FILENAME AND URL FOR CHRONOLOGICAL CLUES ===") image_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith((&#x27;.jpg', '.jpeg', '.png')) "keyword">and 'thieme_becker' "keyword">in f.lower()] "keyword">for img_file "keyword">in image_files: print(f"\nImage file: {img_file}") # The original image URL was "keyword">in the HTML - let's extract it "keyword">if os.path.exists(html_file): "keyword">with open(html_file, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: html_content = f.read() # Look "keyword">for the image URL "keyword">in the HTML "keyword">if &#x27;Perwanger' "keyword">in html_content: # Extract the full image URL "keyword">import re url_pattern = r&#x27;src="([^"]*Perwanger[^"]*)\.jpg[^"]*"' url_match = re.search(url_pattern, html_content) "keyword">if url_match: image_url = url_match.group(1) + &#x27;.jpg' print(f"Original image URL: {image_url}") # Decode the URL to see "keyword">if it contains chronological information "keyword">from urllib.parse "keyword">import unquote decoded_url = unquote(image_url) print(f"Decoded URL: {decoded_url}") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the decoded URL url_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, decoded_url) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: url_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in URL: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if url_years: latest_url_year = max(url_years) print(f"\nüìä URL CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:") print(f" Years found "keyword">in URL: {sorted(list(url_years))}") print(f" Latest year "keyword">in URL: {latest_url_year}") # Check "keyword">if there are any text files "keyword">with extracted content we can analyze print("\n=== EXAMINING EXTRACTED TEXT FILES ===") text_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.txt')] "keyword">for text_file "keyword">in text_files: print(f"\nText file: {text_file}") text_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, text_file) "keyword">with open(text_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: text_content = f.read() print(f"Content length: {len(text_content)} characters") print(f"Content preview: {text_content[:200]}...") # Search "keyword">for years "keyword">in the text content text_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, text_content) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: text_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in {text_file}: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if text_years: print(f" Years "keyword">in {text_file}: {sorted(list(text_years))}") # Examine the JSON analysis files more carefully print("\n=== DETAILED EXAMINATION OF ANALYSIS JSON FILES ===") json_files = [f "keyword">for f "keyword">in all_files "keyword">if f.endswith(&#x27;.json')] "keyword">for json_file "keyword">in json_files: print(f"\nJSON file: {json_file}") json_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, json_file) "keyword">try: "keyword">with open(json_path, &#x27;r', encoding='utf-8') "keyword">as f: json_data = json.load(f) print(f"Keys: {list(json_data.keys())}") # Look "keyword">for any chronological information "keyword">in the JSON json_str = json.dumps(json_data, indent=2) json_years = set() "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, json_str) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: json_years.add(year) print(f" ‚úÖ Found year "keyword">in {json_file}: {year} ({description})") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">if json_years: print(f" Years "keyword">in {json_file}: {sorted(list(json_years))}") # If this "keyword">is a citation file, examine it more closely "keyword">if &#x27;citation' "keyword">in json_file.lower(): print(f" üìã Citation file details:") "keyword">if &#x27;first_citation_reference' "keyword">in json_data: ref = json_data[&#x27;first_citation_reference'] print(f" Reference: {ref}") # Look "keyword">for years "keyword">in the reference text ref_str = str(ref) "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, ref_str) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: print(f" ‚úÖ Year "keyword">in citation reference: {year}") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error reading {json_file}: {str(e)}") # Try alternative OCR approach "keyword">or image analysis print("\n=== ALTERNATIVE IMAGE ANALYSIS APPROACHES ===") # Check "keyword">if we can get more information about the image itself image_file = &#x27;thieme_becker_lexicon_page.jpg' img_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, image_file) "keyword">if os.path.exists(img_path): print(f"\nAnalyzing image file: {image_file}") print(f"Image size: {os.path.getsize(img_path):,} bytes") # Try to get image metadata "keyword">if possible "keyword">try: "keyword">from PIL "keyword">import Image "keyword">from PIL.ExifTags "keyword">import TAGS "keyword">with Image.open(img_path) "keyword">as img: print(f"Image dimensions: {img.size}") print(f"Image format: {img.format}") print(f"Image mode: {img.mode}") # Check "keyword">for EXIF data exifdata = img.getexif() "keyword">if exifdata: print(f"\nüìã EXIF data found:") "keyword">for tag_id "keyword">in exifdata: tag = TAGS.get(tag_id, tag_id) data = exifdata.get(tag_id) print(f" {tag}: {data}") # Look "keyword">for dates "keyword">in EXIF data "keyword">if isinstance(data, str): "keyword">for pattern, description "keyword">in date_patterns: matches = re.finditer(pattern, str(data)) "keyword">for match "keyword">in matches: year_str = match.group(1) "keyword">if match.groups() "keyword">else match.group(0) "keyword">try: year = int(year_str) "keyword">if 1000 <= year <= 2100: print(f" ‚úÖ Year "keyword">in EXIF: {year}") "keyword">except ValueError: "keyword">continue "keyword">else: print(f"No EXIF data found") "keyword">except ImportError: print(f"PIL "keyword">not available "keyword">for image metadata analysis") "keyword">except Exception "keyword">as e: print(f"Error analyzing image metadata: {str(e)}") # Compile all findings print("\n" + "="*80) print("COMPREHENSIVE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY") print("="*80) all_years_found = set() latest_overall_year = "keyword">None sources = [] # Collect years "keyword">from all sources "keyword">if &#x27;found_years_in_html' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and found_years_in_html: all_years_found.update(found_years_in_html) sources.append(f"HTML page content: {sorted(list(found_years_in_html))}") "keyword">if &#x27;url_years' "keyword">in locals() "keyword">and url_years: all_years_found.update(url_years) sources.append(f"Image URL: {sorted(list(url_years))}") "keyword">if all_years_found: latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found) print(f"\nüéØ CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:") print(f" All years found: {sorted(list(all_years_found))}") print(f" Latest chronological year: {latest_overall_year}") print(f"\nüìç SOURCES:") "keyword">for source "keyword">in sources: print(f" - {source}") print(f"\n*** FINAL ANSWER: The latest chronological year date found "keyword">is {latest_overall_year} ***") "keyword">else: print(f"\n‚ùå No chronological years found "keyword">in any source") print(f"\nüìã ANALYSIS SUMMARY:") print(f" - OCR text extraction: Completed but yielded fragmented text") print(f" - HTML page content: Analyzed "keyword">for chronological dates") print(f" - Image URL/filename: Analyzed "keyword">for embedded dates") print(f" - JSON analysis files: Examined "keyword">for chronological information") print(f" - Image metadata: Attempted analysis") print(f"\nüí° POSSIBLE EXPLANATIONS:") print(f" 1. The image may be a historical document "keyword">with poor OCR readability") print(f" 2. Chronological dates may be "keyword">in a format "keyword">not covered by regex patterns") print(f" 3. The image may "keyword">not contain explicit chronological information") print(f" 4. The dates may be "keyword">in Roman numerals "keyword">or non-standard formats") print(f"\nüìÅ All analysis data available "keyword">in workspace: {workspace_dir}") print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive analysis completed!")
üìÑ Output
