"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\n\nprint("=== ACCESSING ARCHIVED WIKIPEDIA PAGE: CARL NEBEL (AUGUST 2023) ===")\nprint("Objective: Retrieve archived version and extract first citation reference link\\n")\n\n# Create workspace directory\nworkspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\nos.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\nprint(f"Created workspace directory: {workspace_dir}\\n")\n\n# Define the target page and date\nurl = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel"\narchive_date = "20230831" # End of August 2023\n\nprint(f"Target URL: {url}")\nprint(f"Target date: August 31, 2023 ({archive_date})\\n")\n\n# Check if archived version is available in Wayback Machine\nprint("=== CHECKING WAYBACK MACHINE AVAILABILITY ===")\napi_url = f"https://archive.org/wayback/available?url={url}&timestamp={archive_date}"\n\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n}\n\ntry:\n print(f"Checking availability: {api_url}")\n avail_response = requests.get(api_url, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if avail_response.status_code == 200:\n avail_data = avail_response.json()\n print(f"API Response status: {avail_response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response data keys: {list(avail_data.keys()) if avail_data else \'No data\'}")\n \n if "archived_snapshots" in avail_data and "closest" in avail_data["archived_snapshots"]:\n closest = avail_data["archived_snapshots"]["closest"]\n print(f"Closest snapshot found: {closest.get(\'available\', \'Unknown status\')}")\n \n if closest.get("available"):\n archive_url = closest["url"]\n archive_timestamp = closest["timestamp"]\n \n # Format the timestamp for display\n formatted_date = f"{archive_timestamp[:4]}-{archive_timestamp[4:6]}-{archive_timestamp[6:8]} {archive_timestamp[8:10]}:{archive_timestamp[10:12]}:{archive_timestamp[12:14]}"\n \n print(f"\\n‚úÖ Archive found!")\n print(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}")\n print(f"Archive timestamp: {archive_timestamp}")\n print(f"Formatted date: {formatted_date}")\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ùå No archived version available for {url} on {archive_date}")\n # Try a broader search for August 2023\n print("Trying broader search for August 2023...")\n broader_date = "202308"\n api_url_broader = f"https://archive.org/wayback/available?url={url}&timestamp={broader_date}"\n avail_response_broader = requests.get(api_url_broader, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if avail_response_broader.status_code == 200:\n avail_data_broader = avail_response_broader.json()\n if "archived_snapshots" in avail_data_broader and "closest" in avail_data_broader["archived_snapshots"]:\n closest_broader = avail_data_broader["archived_snapshots"]["closest"]\n if closest_broader.get("available"):\n archive_url = closest_broader["url"]\n archive_timestamp = closest_broader["timestamp"]\n formatted_date = f"{archive_timestamp[:4]}-{archive_timestamp[4:6]}-{archive_timestamp[6:8]} {archive_timestamp[8:10]}:{archive_timestamp[10:12]}:{archive_timestamp[12:14]}"\n print(f"‚úÖ Found broader match: {formatted_date}")\n else:\n print("‚ùå No archived version found for August 2023")\n exit()\n else:\n print("‚ùå No archived snapshots found")\n exit()\n else:\n print("‚ùå Broader search failed")\n exit()\n else:\n print(f"\\n‚ùå No archived snapshots found for {url}")\n exit()\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Error checking archive availability: HTTP {avail_response.status_code}")\n exit()\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error accessing Wayback Machine API: {str(e)}")\n exit()\n\nprint(f"\\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}")\nprint(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}")',

"role": 'developer',
"code": '# Continue from previous step - retrieve the archived page and extract citation links\nimport os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\nimport re\n\nprint("=== CONTINUING CARL NEBEL WIKIPEDIA ARCHIVE EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Objective: Retrieve archived page content and extract first citation reference link\\n")\n\n# Use the workspace directory from previous execution\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] # Use the most recent one\n print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# Archive URL found in previous step\narchive_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel"\narchive_timestamp = "20230306063201"\nformatted_date = "2023-03-06 06:32:01"\n\nprint(f"\\nUsing archive URL: {archive_url}")\nprint(f"Archive date: {formatted_date}\\n")\n\n# Set up headers for requests\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n}\n\n# Retrieve the archived page\nprint("=== RETRIEVING ARCHIVED PAGE CONTENT ===")\nprint(f"Fetching: {archive_url}")\n\ntry:\n response = requests.get(archive_url, headers=headers, timeout=60)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully retrieved archived page")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n print(f"Content type: {response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'Unknown\')}")\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to retrieve archived page: HTTP {response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}")\n exit()\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error retrieving archived page: {str(e)}")\n exit()\n\n# Parse the HTML content\nprint(f"\\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===")\nsoup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n\n# Get page title\ntitle_element = soup.find(\'title\')\npage_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else \'Unknown\'\nprint(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n\n# Find the main content area (avoiding Wayback Machine navigation)\nmain_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\nif not main_content:\n # Alternative selectors for content\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'class\': \'mw-parser-output\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'bodyContent\'})\nif not main_content:\n print("‚ö†Ô∏è Could not find main content div, using entire body")\n main_content = soup\n\nprint(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name if hasattr(main_content, \'name\') else \'Unknown\'}")\n\n# Extract all citation reference links\nprint(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS ===")\n\n# Look for citation links - these typically appear as [1], [2], etc. and link to references\ncitation_links = []\nreference_links = []\n\n# Method 1: Look for citation links (superscript links with numbers)\nfor sup in main_content.find_all(\'sup\', class_=\'reference\'):\n link = sup.find(\'a\')\n if link and link.get(\'href\'):\n citation_links.append({\n \'citation_number\': sup.get_text().strip(),\n \'href\': link.get(\'href\'),\n \'full_element\': str(sup),\n \'type\': \'citation_reference\'\n })\n\nprint(f"Found {len(citation_links)} citation reference links")\n\n# Method 2: Look for reference section links\nreferences_section = main_content.find(\'span\', {\'id\': \'References\'}) or main_content.find(\'h2\', string=re.compile(r\'References\', re.I))\nif references_section:\n print("Found References section")\n # Find the references list (usually an ordered list after the References heading)\n references_parent = references_section.find_parent()\n if references_parent:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'ol\', class_=\'references\')\n if not ref_list:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'div\', class_=\'reflist\')\n if not ref_list:\n ref_list = references_parent.find_next(\'ol\')\n \n if ref_list:\n print(f"Found references list: {ref_list.name}")\n for i, ref_item in enumerate(ref_list.find_all(\'li\'), 1):\n # Look for external links in each reference\n external_links = ref_item.find_all(\'a\', href=True)\n for link in external_links:\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n reference_links.append({\n \'reference_number\': i,\n \'url\': href,\n \'link_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'full_reference\': ref_item.get_text().strip()[:200] + \'...\' if len(ref_item.get_text().strip()) > 200 else ref_item.get_text().strip(),\n \'type\': \'reference_external_link\'\n })\n break # Only take the first external link from each reference\nelse:\n print("References section not found, searching for reference links in other ways")\n\nprint(f"Found {len(reference_links)} reference external links")\n\n# Method 3: Look for any external links that might be citations\nall_external_links = []\nfor link in main_content.find_all(\'a\', href=True):\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n # Skip Wayback Machine links\n if \'web.archive.org\' not in href and \'archive.org\' not in href:\n all_external_links.append({\n \'url\': href,\n \'link_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'type\': \'external_link\'\n })\n\nprint(f"Found {len(all_external_links)} total external links")\n\n# Identify the first citation reference link\nprint(f"\\n=== IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ===")\n\nfirst_citation = None\nfirst_reference_link = None\n\n# Priority 1: First citation reference link\nif citation_links:\n first_citation = citation_links[0]\n print(f"First citation reference found: {first_citation[\'citation_number\']}")\n print(f"Citation href: {first_citation[\'href\']}")\n print(f"Citation element: {first_citation[\'full_element\']}")\n \n # Try to resolve the citation link to the actual reference\n citation_href = first_citation[\'href\']\n if citation_href.startswith(\'#\'):\n # This is an internal anchor link to a reference\n anchor_id = citation_href[1:] # Remove the #\n print(f"Looking for anchor with ID: {anchor_id}")\n \n # Find the referenced element\n referenced_element = main_content.find(id=anchor_id)\n if referenced_element:\n print(f"Found referenced element: {referenced_element.name}")\n # Look for external links in this reference\n ref_external_links = referenced_element.find_all(\'a\', href=True)\n for link in ref_external_links:\n href = link.get(\'href\')\n if href and (href.startswith(\'http\') or href.startswith(\'https\')):\n if \'web.archive.org\' not in href and \'archive.org\' not in href:\n first_reference_link = {\n \'citation_number\': first_citation[\'citation_number\'],\n \'citation_href\': citation_href,\n \'reference_url\': href,\n \'reference_text\': link.get_text().strip(),\n \'full_reference\': referenced_element.get_text().strip()[:300] + \'...\' if len(referenced_element.get_text().strip()) > 300 else referenced_element.get_text().strip()\n }\n break\n else:\n print(f"Could not find referenced element with ID: {anchor_id}")\n\n# Priority 2: First reference external link if citation resolution failed\nif not first_reference_link and reference_links:\n first_reference_link = reference_links[0]\n print(f"Using first reference external link as fallback")\n\n# Priority 3: First external link if no references found\nif not first_reference_link and all_external_links:\n first_reference_link = all_external_links[0]\n first_reference_link[\'type\'] = \'fallback_external_link\'\n print(f"Using first external link as fallback")\n\n# Display results\nprint(f"\\n=== FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS ===")\n\nif first_reference_link:\n print(f"‚úÖ First citation reference link identified!")\n print(f"Type: {first_reference_link.get(\'type\', \'citation_reference\')}")\n \n if \'citation_number\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Citation number: {first_reference_link[\'citation_number\']}")\n if \'citation_href\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Citation href: {first_reference_link[\'citation_href\']}")\n \n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or first_reference_link.get(\'url\')\n print(f"Reference URL: {reference_url}")\n \n reference_text = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')\n print(f"Reference text: {reference_text}")\n \n if \'full_reference\' in first_reference_link:\n print(f"Full reference: {first_reference_link[\'full_reference\'][:200]}...")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ùå No citation reference links found")\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nprint(f"\\n=== SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE ===")\n\n# Create comprehensive dataset\ncarl_nebel_data = {\n \'extraction_metadata\': {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_url\': \'https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\',\n \'archive_url\': archive_url,\n \'archive_timestamp\': archive_timestamp,\n \'formatted_archive_date\': formatted_date,\n \'page_title\': page_title\n },\n \'citation_statistics\': {\n \'total_citation_references\': len(citation_links),\n \'total_reference_external_links\': len(reference_links),\n \'total_external_links\': len(all_external_links)\n },\n \'first_citation_reference\': first_reference_link,\n \'all_citation_references\': citation_links,\n \'all_reference_links\': reference_links,\n \'all_external_links\': all_external_links[:10] # Limit to first 10 to keep file manageable\n}\n\n# Save main data file\ndata_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json\')\nwith open(data_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(carl_nebel_data, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Citation data saved to: {os.path.basename(data_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(data_file):,} bytes")\n\n# Save raw HTML for reference\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html\')\nwith open(html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: {os.path.basename(html_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes")\n\n# Create summary report\nsummary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'citation_extraction_summary.txt\')\nwith open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"CARL NEBEL - WIKIPEDIA CITATION EXTRACTION SUMMARY\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\'*55}\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Archive Date: {formatted_date}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source URL: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carl_Nebel\\n")\n f.write(f"Archive URL: {archive_url}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"CITATION STATISTICS:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Citation references found: {len(citation_links)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Reference external links: {len(reference_links)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Total external links: {len(all_external_links)}\\n\\n")\n \n if first_reference_link:\n f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Type: {first_reference_link.get(\'type\', \'citation_reference\')}\\n")\n if \'citation_number\' in first_reference_link:\n f.write(f"- Citation number: {first_reference_link[\'citation_number\']}\\n")\n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or first_reference_link.get(\'url\')\n f.write(f"- Reference URL: {reference_url}\\n")\n reference_text = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')\n f.write(f"- Reference text: {reference_text}\\n")\n if \'full_reference\' in first_reference_link:\n f.write(f"- Full reference: {first_reference_link[\'full_reference\'][:200]}...\\n")\n else:\n f.write(f"FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK: Not found\\n")\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===")\nif first_reference_link:\n reference_url = first_reference_link.get(\'reference_url\') or first_reference_link.get(\'url\')\n print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: First citation reference link identified!")\n print(f"üìã Citation URL: {reference_url}")\n print(f"üìÑ Reference text: {first_reference_link.get(\'reference_text\') or first_reference_link.get(\'link_text\', \'\')}")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No citation reference links found in the archived page")\n\nprint(f"üìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")\nprint(f"‚úÖ Carl Nebel Wikipedia citation extraction completed successfully!")',
"description": 'Completing the Carl Nebel Wikipedia archive extraction by retrieving the archived page content and extracting citation reference links. This code: (1) Uses the archive URL found in the previous step to fetch the actual Wikipedia page content from March 6, 2023, (2) Parses the HTML with BeautifulSoup to identify the main content area, (3) Extracts citation reference links using multiple methods - looking for superscript citation links, references section, and external links, (4) Identifies and documents the first citation reference link with its target URL, (5) Saves comprehensive results including the first citation URL, all citation data, raw HTML, and a summary report to the workspace directory. This addresses all remaining PLAN objectives: content retrieval, citation extraction, and documentation of the first citation reference link.',

charset=UTF-8\n\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===\nPage title: Carl Nebel - Wikipedia\nMain content area identified: div\n\n=== EXTRACTING CITATION REFERENCE LINKS ===\nFound 9 citation reference links\nFound References section\nFound references list: ol\nFound 3 reference external links\nFound 0 total external links\n\n=== IDENTIFYING FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK ===\nFirst citation reference found: [1]\nCitation href: #cite_note-thb-1\nCitation element: <sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-thb_1-0"><a href="#cite_note-thb-1">[1]</a></sup>\nLooking for anchor with ID: cite_note-thb-1\nFound referenced element: li\nUsing first reference external link as fallback\n\n=== FIRST CITATION REFERENCE LINK RESULTS ===\n‚úÖ First citation reference link identified!\nType: reference_external_link\nReference URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\nReference text: Thieme-Becker\nFull reference: ^ a b Thieme-Becker, entry "Nebel, Carl"...\n\n=== SAVING RESULTS TO WORKSPACE ===\n‚úÖ Citation data saved to: carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json\n File size: 4,106 bytes\n‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: carl_nebel_wikipedia_march_2023.html\n File size: 90,818 bytes\n‚úÖ Summary report saved to: citation_extraction_summary.txt\n\n=== EXTRACTION COMPLETE ===\nüéØ SUCCESS: First citation reference link identified!\nüìã Citation URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\nüìÑ Reference text: Thieme-Becker\nüìÅ All data saved to workspace: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f\n‚úÖ Carl Nebel Wikipedia citation extraction completed successfully!',

This citation provides biographical information about Carl Nebel and serves as the primary source reference for the Wikipedia article.\n\nThe PLAN objective has been fully achieved with 100% completion - the archived page was successfully accessed, content extracted, and the first citation reference link documented with its specific target URL for subsequent analysis.",

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\nimport re\n\nprint("=== ACCESSING THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE AND ANALYZING IMAGES ===")\nprint("Objective: Download archived Thieme-Becker page and extract chronological dates from images\\n")\n\n# First, let\'s check the workspace structure from previous execution\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1] # Use the most recent one\n print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# Let\'s first inspect the previous results to understand the citation structure\nprint("\\n=== INSPECTING PREVIOUS CITATION EXTRACTION RESULTS ===")\ncitation_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'carl_nebel_citations_march_2023.json\')\n\nif os.path.exists(citation_file):\n print(f"Found citation file: {citation_file}")\n with open(citation_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n citation_data = json.load(f)\n \n print(f"Citation file keys: {list(citation_data.keys())}")\n \n if \'first_citation_reference\' in citation_data and citation_data[\'first_citation_reference\']:\n first_ref = citation_data[\'first_citation_reference\']\n print(f"\\nFirst citation reference structure: {list(first_ref.keys())}")\n \n # Extract the target URL\n target_url = first_ref.get(\'reference_url\') or first_ref.get(\'url\')\n print(f"Target URL: {target_url}")\n print(f"Reference text: {first_ref.get(\'reference_text\', \'N/A\')}")\n \n if target_url:\n thieme_becker_url = target_url\n else:\n print("‚ùå No target URL found in citation data")\n exit()\n else:\n print("‚ùå No first citation reference found in data")\n exit()\nelse:\n # Fallback to the URL from the PLAN\n thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker"\n print(f"Using URL from PLAN: {thieme_becker_url}")\n\nprint(f"\\nTarget Thieme-Becker URL: {thieme_becker_url}")\n\n# Set up headers for requests\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'text/html,application/xhtml+xml,application/xml;q=0.9,image/webp,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.9\',\n \'Accept-Encoding\': \'gzip, deflate\',\n \'Connection\': \'keep-alive\'\n}\n\n# Retrieve the Thieme-Becker archived page\nprint(f"\\n=== RETRIEVING THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE ===")\nprint(f"Fetching: {thieme_becker_url}")\n\ntry:\n response = requests.get(thieme_becker_url, headers=headers, timeout=60)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully retrieved Thieme-Becker page")\n print(f"Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes")\n print(f"Content type: {response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'Unknown\')}")\n print(f"Response encoding: {response.encoding}")\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to retrieve page: HTTP {response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response text preview: {response.text[:500]}")\n exit()\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error retrieving page: {str(e)}")\n exit()\n\n# Parse the HTML content\nprint(f"\\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===")\nsoup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, \'html.parser\')\n\n# Get page title\ntitle_element = soup.find(\'title\')\npage_title = title_element.get_text().strip() if title_element else \'Unknown\'\nprint(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n\n# Save the raw HTML for reference\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_archived_page.html\')\nwith open(html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\nprint(f"‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: {os.path.basename(html_file)} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)")\n\n# Find the main content area (avoiding Wayback Machine navigation)\nmain_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'class\': \'mw-parser-output\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'bodyContent\'})\nif not main_content:\n print("‚ö†Ô∏è Could not find main content div, using entire body")\n main_content = soup.find(\'body\') or soup\n\nprint(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name if hasattr(main_content, \'name\') else \'Unknown\'}")\n\n# Extract all images from the page\nprint(f"\\n=== EXTRACTING ALL IMAGES FROM PAGE ===")\n\n# Find all image elements\nall_images = main_content.find_all(\'img\')\nprint(f"Found {len(all_images)} image elements on the page")\n\nimage_data = []\nfor i, img in enumerate(all_images, 1):\n img_info = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'src\': img.get(\'src\', \'\'),\n \'alt\': img.get(\'alt\', \'\'),\n \'title\': img.get(\'title\', \'\'),\n \'width\': img.get(\'width\', \'\'),\n \'height\': img.get(\'height\', \'\'),\n \'class\': img.get(\'class\', []),\n \'full_element\': str(img)\n }\n \n print(f"\\nImage {i}:")\n print(f" Source: {img_info[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {img_info[\'alt\']}")\n print(f" Title: {img_info[\'title\']}")\n print(f" Dimensions: {img_info[\'width\']} x {img_info[\'height\']}")\n print(f" Classes: {img_info[\'class\']}")\n \n image_data.append(img_info)\n\n# Look for images with actual content (not just icons or decorative elements)\nprint(f"\\n=== FILTERING CONTENT IMAGES ===")\n\ncontent_images = []\nfor img_info in image_data:\n src = img_info[\'src\']\n alt = img_info[\'alt\']\n \n # Skip common non-content images\n skip_patterns = [\n \'commons-logo\',\n \'wikimedia-logo\',\n \'edit-icon\',\n \'external-link\',\n \'wayback\',\n \'archive.org\',\n \'blank.gif\',\n \'spacer.gif\',\n \'pixel.gif\'\n ]\n \n is_content_image = True\n for pattern in skip_patterns:\n if pattern.lower() in src.lower() or pattern.lower() in alt.lower():\n is_content_image = False\n break\n \n # Also check if image has meaningful dimensions\n try:\n width = int(img_info[\'width\']) if img_info[\'width\'] else 0\n height = int(img_info[\'height\']) if img_info[\'height\'] else 0\n if width > 0 and height > 0 and (width < 20 or height < 20):\n is_content_image = False # Too small, likely decorative\n except:\n pass\n \n if is_content_image:\n content_images.append(img_info)\n\nprint(f"Identified {len(content_images)} content images (excluding decorative/system images)")\n\nfor i, img_info in enumerate(content_images, 1):\n print(f"\\nContent Image {i}:")\n print(f" Source: {img_info[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {img_info[\'alt\']}")\n print(f" Title: {img_info[\'title\']}")\n\n# Now we need to download and analyze each content image for text/dates\nprint(f"\\n=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES ===")\n\nimage_analysis_results = []\n\nfor i, img_info in enumerate(content_images, 1):\n print(f"\\nAnalyzing Content Image {i}/{len(content_images)}")\n print(f"Source: {img_info[\'src\']}")\n \n img_src = img_info[\'src\']\n \n # Handle relative URLs\n if img_src.startswith(\'//\'):\n img_src = \'https:\' + img_src\n elif img_src.startswith(\'/\'):\n # Relative to the archived domain\n base_url = thieme_becker_url.split(\'/web/\')[0] + \'/web/\' + thieme_becker_url.split(\'/web/\')[1].split(\'/\')[0] + \'/\'\n img_src = urljoin(base_url, img_src)\n elif not img_src.startswith(\'http\'):\n # Relative to current page\n img_src = urljoin(thieme_becker_url, img_src)\n \n print(f"Full image URL: {img_src}")\n \n try:\n # Download the image\n img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if img_response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)")\n \n # Save the image\n img_extension = \'jpg\' # Default\n if \'.png\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'png\'\n elif \'.gif\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'gif\'\n elif \'.svg\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'svg\'\n \n img_filename = f"thieme_becker_image_{i}.{img_extension}"\n img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename)\n \n with open(img_filepath, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(img_response.content)\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}")\n \n # Analyze the image for text content using OCR\n print(f"üîç Analyzing image for text content...")\n \n # We\'ll use the Hugging Face OCR approach from the examples\n try:\n from gradio_client import Client, handle_file\n \n # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client\n client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR")\n \n # Process the image and extract text using OCR\n ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath))\n \n if ocr_result and ocr_result.strip():\n extracted_text = ocr_result.strip()\n print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):")\n print(f"Text preview: {extracted_text[:200]}..." if len(extracted_text) > 200 else extracted_text)\n \n # Look for chronological dates in the extracted text\n print(f"üîç Searching for chronological dates in extracted text...")\n \n # Comprehensive date patterns\n date_patterns = [\n r\'\\b(19\\d{2}|20\\d{2})\\b\', # 4-digit years (1900-2099)\n r\'\\b(18\\d{2})\\b\', # 4-digit years (1800-1899)\n r\'\\b(17\\d{2})\\b\', # 4-digit years (1700-1799)\n r\'\\b(16\\d{2})\\b\', # 4-digit years (1600-1699)\n r\'\\b(15\\d{2})\\b\', # 4-digit years (1500-1599)\n r\'\\b\\d{1,2}[./\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\-](\\d{4})\\b\', # Date formats with 4-digit year\n r\'\\b(\\d{4})[./\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\-]\\d{1,2}\\b\', # Year-first date formats\n ]\n \n found_years = set()\n for pattern in date_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text)\n for match in matches:\n # Extract the year from the match\n year_str = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group(0)\n try:\n year = int(year_str)\n if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range\n found_years.add(year)\n print(f" Found year: {year} (from pattern: {pattern})")\n except ValueError:\n continue\n \n # Store analysis results\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': True,\n \'extracted_text\': extracted_text,\n \'found_years\': sorted(list(found_years)),\n \'latest_year\': max(found_years) if found_years else None\n }\n \n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n if found_years:\n latest_year = max(found_years)\n print(f"üìÖ Latest chronological year found in image: {latest_year}")\n else:\n print(f"üìÖ No chronological years found in image text")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted from image")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': \'\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except ImportError:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è OCR client not available - cannot extract text from image")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': \'OCR not available\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except Exception as ocr_error:\n print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': f\'OCR failed: {str(ocr_error)}\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': None,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': False,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': \'\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'image_filename\': None,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'download_success\': False,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': f\'Error: {str(e)}\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n # Add delay between image downloads\n time.sleep(2)\n\n# Analyze all results to find the latest chronological year\nprint(f"\\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===")\nprint(f"Total images analyzed: {len(image_analysis_results)}")\n\nall_years_found = []\nfor result in image_analysis_results:\n if result[\'found_years\']:\n all_years_found.extend(result[\'found_years\'])\n print(f"\\nImage {result[\'image_number\']} ({result[\'image_filename\']})")\n print(f" Years found: {result[\'found_years\']}")\n print(f" Latest year: {result[\'latest_year\']}")\n print(f" Text preview: {result[\'extracted_text\'][:100]}..." if len(result[\'extracted_text\']) > 100 else result[\'extracted_text\'])\n\nif all_years_found:\n latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found)\n print(f"\\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR FOUND ACROSS ALL IMAGES: {latest_overall_year}")\n \n # Find which image(s) contained this latest year\n images_with_latest_year = []\n for result in image_analysis_results:\n if result[\'latest_year\'] == latest_overall_year:\n images_with_latest_year.append(result)\n \n print(f"\\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_overall_year}) FOUND IN:")\n for result in images_with_latest_year:\n print(f" - Image {result[\'image_number\']}: {result[\'image_filename\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: {result[\'image_alt\']}")\n print(f" Title: {result[\'image_title\']}")\nelse:\n print(f"\\n‚ùå No chronological years found in any images")\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nprint(f"\\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===")\n\nfinal_results = {\n \'analysis_metadata\': {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_url\': thieme_becker_url,\n \'page_title\': page_title,\n \'total_images_found\': len(all_images),\n \'content_images_identified\': len(content_images),\n \'images_analyzed\': len(image_analysis_results)\n },\n \'image_analysis_results\': image_analysis_results,\n \'chronological_summary\': {\n \'all_years_found\': sorted(list(set(all_years_found))),\n \'latest_year\': max(all_years_found) if all_years_found else None,\n \'total_years_found\': len(set(all_years_found)),\n \'images_with_years\': len([r for r in image_analysis_results if r[\'found_years\']])\n }\n}\n\n# Save main results file\nresults_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_image_analysis.json\')\nwith open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes")\n\n# Create summary report\nsummary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_analysis_summary.txt\')\nwith open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER ARCHIVED PAGE - IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\'*65}\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source URL: {thieme_becker_url}\\n")\n f.write(f"Page Title: {page_title}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"IMAGE STATISTICS:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Total images found on page: {len(all_images)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Content images identified: {len(content_images)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Images successfully analyzed: {len(image_analysis_results)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Images with chronological years: {len([r for r in image_analysis_results if r[\'found_years\']])}\\n\\n")\n \n if all_years_found:\n f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\\n")\n f.write(f"- All years found: {sorted(list(set(all_years_found)))}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Latest chronological year: {max(all_years_found)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Total unique years: {len(set(all_years_found))}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"IMAGES WITH LATEST YEAR ({max(all_years_found)}):")\n for result in images_with_latest_year:\n f.write(f"\\n- Image {result[\'image_number\']}: {result[\'image_filename\']}")\n f.write(f"\\n Alt text: {result[\'image_alt\']}")\n f.write(f"\\n Title: {result[\'image_title\']}")\n f.write(f"\\n Years found: {result[\'found_years\']}")\n else:\n f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found in any images\\n")\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}")\n\nprint(f"\\n=== THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===")\nif all_years_found:\n latest_year = max(all_years_found)\n print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found in images: {latest_year}")\n print(f"üìä Total unique years found: {len(set(all_years_found))}")\n print(f"üìã All years: {sorted(list(set(all_years_found)))}")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found in any images on the page")\n\nprint(f"üìÅ All data and images saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")\nprint(f"‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed successfully!")',
"description": "Following the PLAN to access the first citation reference link from Carl Nebel's Wikipedia page (the Thieme-Becker biographical dictionary entry at http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker). This code: (1) Inspects the previous citation extraction results to confirm the target URL, (2) Downloads and parses the complete Thieme-Becker archived webpage, (3) Identifies and extracts all images present on the page, filtering out decorative/system images to focus on content images, (4) Downloads each content image and saves it to the workspace, (5) Uses OCR (Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR) to extract all visible text from each image, (6) Analyzes the extracted text using comprehensive regex patterns to identify chronological years (1500-2100 range), (7) Determines the latest (most recent) chronological year found across all images, (8) Saves comprehensive results including all extracted text, found years, and identifies which specific image(s) contain the latest chronological date. This addresses all PLAN requirements: accessing the citation link, downloading the webpage, analyzing images, and identifying the latest chronological year date.",

charset=UTF-8\nResponse encoding: UTF-8\n\n=== PARSING HTML CONTENT ===\nPage title: Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia\n‚úÖ Raw HTML saved to: thieme_becker_archived_page.html (181,560 bytes)\nMain content area identified: div\n\n=== EXTRACTING ALL IMAGES FROM PAGE ===\nFound 3 image elements on the page\n\nImage 1:\n Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg\n Alt text: \n Title: \n Dimensions: 220 x 357\n Classes: ['thumbimage']\n\nImage 2:\n Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/15px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png\n Alt text: \n Title: Wikisource\n Dimensions: 15 x 16\n Classes: []\n\nImage 3:\n Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:CentralAutoLogin/start?type=1x1\n Alt text: \n Title: \n Dimensions: 1 x 1\n Classes: []\n\n=== FILTERING CONTENT IMAGES ===\nIdentified 0 content images (excluding decorative/system images)\n\n=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES ===\n\n=== COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS RESULTS ===\nTotal images analyzed: 0\n\n‚ùå No chronological years found in any images\n\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===\n‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: thieme_becker_image_analysis.json\n File size: 491 bytes\n‚úÖ Summary report saved to: thieme_becker_analysis_summary.txt\n\n=== THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS COMPLETE ===\n‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found in any images on the page\nüìÅ All data and images saved to workspace: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f\n‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed successfully!",

{
"role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\nimport re\n\nprint("=== CORRECTED THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS WITH PROPER FILTERING ===")\nprint("Objective: Fix filtering criteria and analyze all relevant images for chronological dates\\n")\n\n# Use existing workspace directory\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[-1]\n print(f"Using existing workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n print("‚ùå No workspace directory found")\n exit()\n\n# First, let\'s inspect the saved HTML file to understand the page structure\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_archived_page.html\')\nif not os.path.exists(html_file):\n print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file not found")\n exit()\n\nprint(f"Found saved HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)")\n\n# Load and parse the saved HTML\nwith open(html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n\nsoup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\npage_title = soup.find(\'title\').get_text().strip() if soup.find(\'title\') else \'Unknown\'\nprint(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n\n# Find main content area\nmain_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'class\': \'mw-parser-output\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'bodyContent\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'body\') or soup\n\nprint(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name if hasattr(main_content, \'name\') else \'Unknown\'}")\n\n# Extract all images with detailed analysis\nprint(f"\\n=== DETAILED IMAGE EXTRACTION AND ANALYSIS ===")\nall_images = main_content.find_all(\'img\')\nprint(f"Found {len(all_images)} image elements on the page")\n\nimage_details = []\nfor i, img in enumerate(all_images, 1):\n img_info = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'src\': img.get(\'src\', \'\'),\n \'alt\': img.get(\'alt\', \'\'),\n \'title\': img.get(\'title\', \'\'),\n \'width\': img.get(\'width\', \'\'),\n \'height\': img.get(\'height\', \'\'),\n \'class\': img.get(\'class\', []),\n \'full_element\': str(img)\n }\n \n print(f"\\nImage {i} - Detailed Analysis:")\n print(f" Source: {img_info[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: \'{img_info[\'alt\']}\'")\n print(f" Title: \'{img_info[\'title\']}\'")\n print(f" Dimensions: {img_info[\'width\']} x {img_info[\'height\']}")\n print(f" Classes: {img_info[\'class\']}")\n \n # Analyze if this is a content image with corrected criteria\n is_content_image = True\n exclusion_reason = None\n \n # Check for system/decorative image patterns\n src = img_info[\'src\'].lower()\n alt = img_info[\'alt\'].lower()\n \n system_patterns = [\n \'wikisource-logo\',\n \'commons-logo\', \n \'wikimedia-logo\',\n \'edit-icon\',\n \'external-link\',\n \'centralautologin\', # The 1x1 tracking pixel\n \'blank.gif\',\n \'spacer.gif\',\n \'pixel.gif\'\n ]\n \n for pattern in system_patterns:\n if pattern in src or pattern in alt:\n is_content_image = False\n exclusion_reason = f"System/decorative pattern: {pattern}"\n break\n \n # Check dimensions - be more permissive for content images\n if is_content_image:\n try:\n width = int(img_info[\'width\']) if img_info[\'width\'] else 0\n height = int(img_info[\'height\']) if img_info[\'height\'] else 0\n \n # Only exclude very small images (likely icons/pixels)\n if width > 0 and height > 0 and (width <= 10 and height <= 10):\n is_content_image = False\n exclusion_reason = f"Too small: {width}x{height} (likely icon/pixel)"\n elif width >= 50 or height >= 50: # Any image with at least one dimension >= 50px is likely content\n is_content_image = True\n exclusion_reason = None\n except ValueError:\n pass # Keep as content image if dimensions can\'t be parsed\n \n # Special consideration for thumbimage class (Wikipedia thumbnail images)\n if \'thumbimage\' in img_info[\'class\']:\n is_content_image = True\n exclusion_reason = None\n print(f" ‚úÖ Identified as thumbnail content image (thumbimage class)")\n \n img_info[\'is_content_image\'] = is_content_image\n img_info[\'exclusion_reason\'] = exclusion_reason\n \n if is_content_image:\n print(f" ‚úÖ CONTENT IMAGE - Will be analyzed")\n else:\n print(f" ‚ùå EXCLUDED - {exclusion_reason}")\n \n image_details.append(img_info)\n\n# Filter content images with corrected criteria\ncontent_images = [img for img in image_details if img[\'is_content_image\']]\nprint(f"\\n=== CONTENT IMAGES IDENTIFIED ===")\nprint(f"Total content images: {len(content_images)}")\n\nfor img in content_images:\n print(f"\\nContent Image {img[\'image_number\']}:")\n print(f" Source: {img[\'src\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: \'{img[\'alt\']}\'")\n print(f" Title: \'{img[\'title\']}\'")\n print(f" Dimensions: {img[\'width\']} x {img[\'height\']}")\n print(f" Classes: {img[\'class\']}")\n\nif not content_images:\n print("‚ùå No content images identified for analysis")\n exit()\n\n# Download and analyze each content image\nprint(f"\\n=== DOWNLOADING AND ANALYZING CONTENT IMAGES ===")\n\n# Get the base URL for resolving relative image URLs\nthieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker"\nbase_archive_url = "http://web.archive.org"\n\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.9\'\n}\n\nimage_analysis_results = []\n\nfor i, img_info in enumerate(content_images, 1):\n print(f"\\nAnalyzing Content Image {i}/{len(content_images)}")\n print(f"Original source: {img_info[\'src\']}")\n \n img_src = img_info[\'src\']\n \n # Handle relative URLs for archived content\n if img_src.startswith(\'//\'):\n img_src = \'https:\' + img_src\n elif img_src.startswith(\'/web/\'):\n img_src = base_archive_url + img_src\n elif img_src.startswith(\'/\'):\n img_src = base_archive_url + img_src\n elif not img_src.startswith(\'http\'):\n img_src = urljoin(thieme_becker_url, img_src)\n \n print(f"Resolved image URL: {img_src}")\n \n try:\n # Download the image\n print(f"Downloading image...")\n img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if img_response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)")\n \n # Determine file extension\n img_extension = \'jpg\' # Default\n content_type = img_response.headers.get(\'content-type\', \'\').lower()\n if \'png\' in content_type or \'.png\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'png\'\n elif \'gif\' in content_type or \'.gif\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'gif\'\n elif \'svg\' in content_type or \'.svg\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'svg\'\n elif \'webp\' in content_type or \'.webp\' in img_src.lower():\n img_extension = \'webp\'\n \n # Save the image\n img_filename = f"thieme_becker_content_image_{i}.{img_extension}"\n img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename)\n \n with open(img_filepath, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(img_response.content)\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}")\n \n # Analyze the image for text content using OCR\n print(f"üîç Analyzing image for text content using OCR...")\n \n try:\n from gradio_client import Client, handle_file\n \n # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client\n client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR")\n \n # Process the image and extract text using OCR\n print(f"Sending image to OCR service...")\n ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath))\n \n if ocr_result and ocr_result.strip():\n extracted_text = ocr_result.strip()\n print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):")\n print(f"Raw extracted text:")\n print(f"{\'=\'*60}")\n print(extracted_text)\n print(f"{\'=\'*60}")\n \n # Search for chronological dates in the extracted text\n print(f"\\nüîç Searching for chronological dates in extracted text...")\n \n # Comprehensive date patterns for different formats\n date_patterns = [\n (r\'\\b(20\\d{2})\\b\', \'2000s years\'), # 2000-2099\n (r\'\\b(19\\d{2})\\b\', \'1900s years\'), # 1900-1999\n (r\'\\b(18\\d{2})\\b\', \'1800s years\'), # 1800-1899\n (r\'\\b(17\\d{2})\\b\', \'1700s years\'), # 1700-1799\n (r\'\\b(16\\d{2})\\b\', \'1600s years\'), # 1600-1699\n (r\'\\b(15\\d{2})\\b\', \'1500s years\'), # 1500-1599\n (r\'\\b(14\\d{2})\\b\', \'1400s years\'), # 1400-1499\n (r\'\\b\\d{1,2}[./\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\-](\\d{4})\\b\', \'Date with 4-digit year\'),\n (r\'\\b(\\d{4})[./\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\-]\\d{1,2}\\b\', \'Year-first date format\'),\n (r\'\\b(\\d{4})\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*\\d{4}\\b\', \'Year range (first year)\'),\n (r\'\\b\\d{4}\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\s*(\\d{4})\\b\', \'Year range (second year)\'),\n ]\n \n found_years = set()\n pattern_matches = []\n \n for pattern, description in date_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n for match in matches:\n # Extract the year from the match\n year_str = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group(0)\n try:\n year = int(year_str)\n if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range\n found_years.add(year)\n match_context = extracted_text[max(0, match.start()-20):match.end()+20]\n pattern_matches.append({\n \'year\': year,\n \'pattern\': description,\n \'match_text\': match.group(0),\n \'context\': match_context.strip()\n })\n print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year} (Pattern: {description})")\n print(f" Match: \'{match.group(0)}\' in context: \'{match_context.strip()}\'")\n except ValueError:\n continue\n \n # Also look for Roman numerals that might represent years\n roman_pattern = r\'\\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\\b\'\n roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n for match in roman_matches:\n roman_numeral = match.group(0)\n # Simple Roman numeral to year conversion for common patterns\n if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year if reasonably long\n print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral} (manual interpretation may be needed)")\n \n # Store comprehensive analysis results\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': True,\n \'extracted_text\': extracted_text,\n \'extracted_text_length\': len(extracted_text),\n \'found_years\': sorted(list(found_years)),\n \'pattern_matches\': pattern_matches,\n \'latest_year\': max(found_years) if found_years else None,\n \'total_years_found\': len(found_years)\n }\n \n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n if found_years:\n latest_year = max(found_years)\n print(f"\\nüìÖ SUMMARY FOR THIS IMAGE:")\n print(f" Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}")\n print(f" Latest year: {latest_year}")\n print(f" Total years: {len(found_years)}")\n else:\n print(f"\\nüìÖ No chronological years found in this image")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted from image (OCR returned empty result)")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'ocr_failure_reason\': \'No text extracted\',\n \'extracted_text\': \'\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except ImportError:\n print(f"‚ùå OCR client not available - gradio_client not installed")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'ocr_failure_reason\': \'OCR client not available\',\n \'extracted_text\': \'OCR not available - gradio_client not installed\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except Exception as ocr_error:\n print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': True,\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'ocr_failure_reason\': str(ocr_error),\n \'extracted_text\': f\'OCR failed: {str(ocr_error)}\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response headers: {dict(img_response.headers)}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': None,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': False,\n \'download_failure_reason\': f\'HTTP {img_response.status_code}\',\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': \'\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n except Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}")\n analysis_result = {\n \'image_number\': img_info[\'image_number\'],\n \'image_filename\': None,\n \'image_src\': img_info[\'src\'],\n \'image_alt\': img_info[\'alt\'],\n \'image_title\': img_info[\'title\'],\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{img_info[\'width\']}x{img_info[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': img_info[\'class\'],\n \'download_success\': False,\n \'download_failure_reason\': str(e),\n \'ocr_success\': False,\n \'extracted_text\': f\'Error: {str(e)}\',\n \'found_years\': [],\n \'latest_year\': None\n }\n image_analysis_results.append(analysis_result)\n \n # Add delay between image downloads\n time.sleep(2)\n\n# Comprehensive analysis of all results\nprint(f"\\n" + "="*80)\nprint(f"COMPREHENSIVE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS")\nprint(f"="*80)\n\nprint(f"Total images analyzed: {len(image_analysis_results)}")\nsuccessful_downloads = len([r for r in image_analysis_results if r[\'download_success\']])\nsuccessful_ocr = len([r for r in image_analysis_results if r.get(\'ocr_success\', False)])\nprint(f"Successful downloads: {successful_downloads}")\nprint(f"Successful OCR extractions: {successful_ocr}")\n\n# Collect all years found across all images\nall_years_found = []\nall_pattern_matches = []\nfor result in image_analysis_results:\n if result.get(\'found_years\'):\n all_years_found.extend(result[\'found_years\'])\n if result.get(\'pattern_matches\'):\n all_pattern_matches.extend(result[\'pattern_matches\'])\n\nprint(f"\\nüìä CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS SUMMARY:")\nif all_years_found:\n unique_years = sorted(list(set(all_years_found)))\n latest_overall_year = max(all_years_found)\n \n print(f" Total years found: {len(all_years_found)}")\n print(f" Unique years: {len(unique_years)}")\n print(f" Year range: {min(unique_years)} - {max(unique_years)}")\n print(f" All unique years: {unique_years}")\n print(f"\\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_overall_year}")\n \n # Find which image(s) contained the latest year\n images_with_latest_year = []\n for result in image_analysis_results:\n if result.get(\'latest_year\') == latest_overall_year:\n images_with_latest_year.append(result)\n \n print(f"\\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_overall_year}) FOUND IN:")\n for result in images_with_latest_year:\n print(f" Image {result[\'image_number\']}: {result.get(\'image_filename\', \'N/A\')}")\n print(f" Dimensions: {result[\'image_dimensions\']}")\n print(f" Classes: {result[\'image_classes\']}")\n print(f" Alt text: \'{result[\'image_alt\']}\'")\n print(f" All years in this image: {result.get(\'found_years\', [])}")\n \n # Show the specific pattern matches for the latest year\n if result.get(\'pattern_matches\'):\n latest_matches = [m for m in result[\'pattern_matches\'] if m[\'year\'] == latest_overall_year]\n for match in latest_matches:\n print(f" Match context: \'{match[\'context\']}\'")\n print(f" Pattern type: {match[\'pattern\']}")\n print()\n \n # Show detailed breakdown by image\n print(f"üìã DETAILED BREAKDOWN BY IMAGE:")\n for result in image_analysis_results:\n if result.get(\'found_years\'):\n print(f"\\n Image {result[\'image_number\']} ({result.get(\'image_filename\', \'N/A\')}):")\n print(f" Years found: {result[\'found_years\']}")\n print(f" Latest year: {result.get(\'latest_year\')}")\n print(f" Text length: {result.get(\'extracted_text_length\', 0)} characters")\n if result.get(\'pattern_matches\'):\n print(f" Pattern matches:")\n for match in result[\'pattern_matches\'][:3]: # Show first 3 matches\n print(f" - {match[\'year\']}: \'{match[\'context\']}\'")\nelse:\n print(f" ‚ùå No chronological years found in any images")\n print(f"\\nüìã OCR EXTRACTION RESULTS:")\n for result in image_analysis_results:\n print(f"\\n Image {result[\'image_number\']} ({result.get(\'image_filename\', \'N/A\')}):")\n print(f" Download success: {result[\'download_success\']}")\n print(f" OCR success: {result.get(\'ocr_success\', False)}")\n if not result.get(\'ocr_success\', False):\n print(f" Failure reason: {result.get(\'ocr_failure_reason\', \'Unknown\')}")\n else:\n text_preview = result.get(\'extracted_text\', \'\')[:100]\n print(f" Text preview: \'{text_preview}...\'")\n\n# Save comprehensive results\nprint(f"\\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===")\n\nfinal_results = {\n \'analysis_metadata\': {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_url\': thieme_becker_url,\n \'page_title\': page_title,\n \'total_images_found\': len(all_images),\n \'content_images_identified\': len(content_images),\n \'images_analyzed\': len(image_analysis_results),\n \'successful_downloads\': successful_downloads,\n \'successful_ocr_extractions\': successful_ocr\n },\n \'image_analysis_results\': image_analysis_results,\n \'chronological_summary\': {\n \'all_years_found\': all_years_found,\n \'unique_years\': sorted(list(set(all_years_found))) if all_years_found else [],\n \'latest_year\': max(all_years_found) if all_years_found else None,\n \'earliest_year\': min(all_years_found) if all_years_found else None,\n \'total_years_found\': len(all_years_found),\n \'unique_years_count\': len(set(all_years_found)) if all_years_found else 0,\n \'images_with_years\': len([r for r in image_analysis_results if r.get(\'found_years\')]),\n \'pattern_matches\': all_pattern_matches\n }\n}\n\n# Save main results file\nresults_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_corrected_image_analysis.json\')\nwith open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n\nprint(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}")\nprint(f" File size: Total images found on page: {len(all_images)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Content images identified: {len(content_images)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Images successfully downloaded: {successful_downloads}\\n")\n "role": 'developer',
"code": 'import os\nimport requests\nfrom bs4 import BeautifulSoup\nimport json\nfrom datetime import datetime\nimport time\nfrom urllib.parse import urljoin, unquote\nimport re\n\nprint("=== RESUMING THIEME-BECKER IMAGE ANALYSIS - COMPLETING OCR EXTRACTION ===")\nprint("Objective: Complete the interrupted image download and OCR analysis for chronological dates\\n")\n\n# Check workspace structure and find the correct workspace\nworkspace_dirs = [d for d in os.listdir(\'.\') if d.startswith(\'workspace\')]\nif workspace_dirs:\n # Sort by modification time to get the most recent\n workspace_dirs.sort(key=lambda x: os.path.getmtime(x), reverse=True)\n workspace_dir = workspace_dirs[0]\n print(f"Using most recent workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\nelse:\n workspace_dir = f"workspace_{datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y%m%d_%H%M%S\')}"\n os.makedirs(workspace_dir, exist_ok=True)\n print(f"Created new workspace directory: {workspace_dir}")\n\n# Check what files exist in the workspace\nprint(f"\\nWorkspace contents:")\nif os.path.exists(workspace_dir):\n for file in os.listdir(workspace_dir):\n file_path = os.path.join(workspace_dir, file)\n file_size = os.path.getsize(file_path)\n print(f" - {file} ({file_size:,} bytes)")\nelse:\n print(" (empty or doesn\'t exist)")\n\n# Load the saved HTML file to continue analysis\nhtml_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_archived_page.html\')\nif not os.path.exists(html_file):\n print("‚ùå Thieme-Becker HTML file not found - need to re-download")\n # Re-download the page\n thieme_becker_url = "http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker"\n headers = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\'\n }\n \n print(f"Re-downloading Thieme-Becker page: {thieme_becker_url}")\n response = requests.get(thieme_becker_url, headers=headers, timeout=60)\n \n if response.status_code == 200:\n with open(html_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(response.text)\n print(f"‚úÖ Page re-downloaded and saved ({len(response.content):,} bytes)")\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to re-download page: HTTP {response.status_code}")\n exit()\nelse:\n print(f"Found existing HTML file: {html_file} ({os.path.getsize(html_file):,} bytes)")\n\n# Load and parse the HTML\nwith open(html_file, \'r\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n html_content = f.read()\n\nsoup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, \'html.parser\')\npage_title = soup.find(\'title\').get_text().strip() if soup.find(\'title\') else \'Unknown\'\nprint(f"Page title: {page_title}")\n\n# Find main content area\nmain_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'mw-content-text\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'class\': \'mw-parser-output\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'div\', {\'id\': \'bodyContent\'})\nif not main_content:\n main_content = soup.find(\'body\') or soup\n\nprint(f"Main content area identified: {main_content.name if hasattr(main_content, \'name\') else \'Unknown\'}")\n\n# Extract and identify the content image (the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker lexicon image)\nprint(f"\\n=== IDENTIFYING THE CONTENT IMAGE ===")\nall_images = main_content.find_all(\'img\')\nprint(f"Found {len(all_images)} total images on the page")\n\n# Find the specific content image we need to analyze\ncontent_image = None\nfor i, img in enumerate(all_images, 1):\n src = img.get(\'src\', \'\')\n classes = img.get(\'class\', [])\n width = img.get(\'width\', \'\')\n height = img.get(\'height\', \'\')\n \n print(f"\\nImage {i}:")\n print(f" Source: {src}")\n print(f" Classes: {classes}")\n print(f" Dimensions: {width} x {height}")\n \n # Identify the Perwanger/Thieme-Becker content image\n if \'thumbimage\' in classes and \'Perwanger\' in src:\n content_image = {\n \'image_number\': i,\n \'src\': src,\n \'alt\': img.get(\'alt\', \'\'),\n \'title\': img.get(\'title\', \'\'),\n \'width\': width,\n \'height\': height,\n \'class\': classes,\n \'full_element\': str(img)\n }\n print(f" ‚úÖ IDENTIFIED AS CONTENT IMAGE - Contains Thieme-Becker lexicon content")\n break\n else:\n print(f" ‚ùå Skipping - Not the target content image")\n\nif not content_image:\n print("‚ùå Could not find the Thieme-Becker content image")\n exit()\n\nprint(f"\\n=== CONTENT IMAGE DETAILS ===")\nprint(f"Image source: {content_image[\'src\']}")\nprint(f"Dimensions: {content_image[\'width\']} x {content_image[\'height\']}")\nprint(f"Classes: {content_image[\'class\']}")\n\n# Download the content image\nprint(f"\\n=== DOWNLOADING CONTENT IMAGE ===")\nimg_src = content_image[\'src\']\n\n# Handle the archived URL format\nif img_src.startswith(\'//\'):\n img_src = \'https:\' + img_src\n\nprint(f"Full image URL: {img_src}")\n\nheaders = {\n \'User-Agent\': \'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36\',\n \'Accept\': \'image/webp,image/apng,image/*,*/*;q=0.8\',\n \'Accept-Language\': \'en-US,en;q=0.9\'\n}\n\ntry:\n print(f"Downloading image...")\n img_response = requests.get(img_src, headers=headers, timeout=30)\n \n if img_response.status_code == 200:\n print(f"‚úÖ Successfully downloaded image ({len(img_response.content):,} bytes)")\n \n # Save the image\n img_filename = "thieme_becker_lexicon_page.jpg"\n img_filepath = os.path.join(workspace_dir, img_filename)\n \n with open(img_filepath, \'wb\') as f:\n f.write(img_response.content)\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Image saved to: {img_filename}")\n \n # Analyze the image for text content using OCR\n print(f"\\n=== OCR TEXT EXTRACTION ===")\n print(f"üîç Analyzing image for text content using Hugging Face OCR...")\n \n try:\n from gradio_client import Client, handle_file\n \n # Initialize Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR client\n print(f"Initializing OCR client...")\n client = Client("kneelesh48/Tesseract-OCR")\n \n # Process the image and extract text using OCR\n print(f"Sending image to OCR service...")\n ocr_result = client.predict(handle_file(img_filepath))\n \n if ocr_result and ocr_result.strip():\n extracted_text = ocr_result.strip()\n print(f"‚úÖ OCR extracted text ({len(extracted_text)} characters):")\n print(f"\\nRAW EXTRACTED TEXT:")\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n print(extracted_text)\n print(f"{\'=\'*80}")\n \n # Search for chronological dates in the extracted text\n print(f"\\n=== SEARCHING FOR CHRONOLOGICAL DATES ===")\n print(f"üîç Analyzing extracted text for chronological years...")\n \n # Comprehensive date patterns for different formats\n date_patterns = [\n (r\'\\b(20\\d{2})\\b\', \'2000s years\'), # 2000-2099\n (r\'\\b(19\\d{2})\\b\', \'1900s years\'), # 1900-1999\n (r\'\\b(18\\d{2})\\b\', \'1800s years\'), # 1800-1899\n (r\'\\b(17\\d{2})\\b\', \'1700s years\'), # 1700-1799\n (r\'\\b(16\\d{2})\\b\', \'1600s years\'), # 1600-1699\n (r\'\\b(15\\d{2})\\b\', \'1500s years\'), # 1500-1599\n (r\'\\b(14\\d{2})\\b\', \'1400s years\'), # 1400-1499\n (r\'\\b\\d{1,2}[./\\\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\\\-](\\d{4})\\b\', \'Date with 4-digit year\'),\n (r\'\\b(\\d{4})[./\\\\-]\\d{1,2}[./\\\\-]\\d{1,2}\\b\', \'Year-first date format\'),\n (r\'\\b(\\d{4})\\\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\\\s*\\d{4}\\b\', \'Year range (first year)\'),\n (r\'\\b\\d{4}\\\\s*[-‚Äì‚Äî]\\\\s*(\\d{4})\\b\', \'Year range (second year)\'),\n ]\n \n found_years = set()\n pattern_matches = []\n \n for pattern, description in date_patterns:\n matches = re.finditer(pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n for match in matches:\n # Extract the year from the match\n year_str = match.group(1) if match.groups() else match.group(0)\n try:\n year = int(year_str)\n if 1000 <= year <= 2100: # Reasonable year range\n found_years.add(year)\n # Get context around the match\n context_start = max(0, match.start() - 30)\n context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 30)\n match_context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end]\n \n pattern_matches.append({\n \'year\': year,\n \'pattern\': description,\n \'match_text\': match.group(0),\n \'context\': match_context.strip(),\n \'position\': match.start()\n })\n print(f" ‚úÖ Found year: {year}")\n print(f" Pattern: {description}")\n print(f" Match: \'{match.group(0)}\'")\n print(f" Context: \'{match_context.strip()}\'")\n print()\n except ValueError:\n continue\n \n # Also look for Roman numerals that might represent years\n print(f"üîç Searching for Roman numerals...")\n roman_pattern = r\'\\b(M{0,3})(CM|CD|D?C{0,3})(XC|XL|L?X{0,3})(IX|IV|V?I{0,3})\\b\'\n roman_matches = re.finditer(roman_pattern, extracted_text, re.IGNORECASE)\n roman_numerals_found = []\n for match in roman_matches:\n roman_numeral = match.group(0)\n if len(roman_numeral) >= 3: # Likely a year if reasonably long\n roman_numerals_found.append(roman_numeral)\n context_start = max(0, match.start() - 20)\n context_end = min(len(extracted_text), match.end() + 20)\n context = extracted_text[context_start:context_end]\n print(f" üìú Found Roman numeral: {roman_numeral}")\n print(f" Context: \'{context.strip()}\'")\n \n # Analyze results\n print(f"\\n=== CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS RESULTS ===")\n if found_years:\n sorted_years = sorted(list(found_years))\n latest_year = max(found_years)\n earliest_year = min(found_years)\n \n print(f"üìä CHRONOLOGICAL SUMMARY:")\n print(f" Total years found: {len(found_years)}")\n print(f" Year range: {earliest_year} - {latest_year}")\n print(f" All years: {sorted_years}")\n print(f"\\nüéØ LATEST CHRONOLOGICAL YEAR: {latest_year}")\n \n # Find the context for the latest year\n latest_year_matches = [m for m in pattern_matches if m[\'year\'] == latest_year]\n if latest_year_matches:\n print(f"\\nüìç LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) CONTEXT:")\n for match in latest_year_matches:\n print(f" Pattern: {match[\'pattern\']}")\n print(f" Match: \'{match[\'match_text\']}\'")\n print(f" Context: \'{match[\'context\']}\'")\n print(f" Position: {match[\'position\']}")\n print()\n else:\n print(f"‚ùå No chronological years found in the extracted text")\n latest_year = None\n \n # Save comprehensive results\n print(f"\\n=== SAVING COMPREHENSIVE RESULTS ===")\n \n final_results = {\n \'analysis_metadata\': {\n \'timestamp\': datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\'),\n \'source_url\': \'http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\',\n \'page_title\': page_title,\n \'image_filename\': img_filename,\n \'image_dimensions\': f"{content_image[\'width\']}x{content_image[\'height\']}",\n \'image_classes\': content_image[\'class\']\n },\n \'ocr_results\': {\n \'success\': True,\n \'extracted_text\': extracted_text,\n \'text_length\': len(extracted_text)\n },\n \'chronological_analysis\': {\n \'found_years\': sorted(list(found_years)) if found_years else [],\n \'latest_year\': latest_year,\n \'earliest_year\': min(found_years) if found_years else None,\n \'total_years_found\': len(found_years),\n \'pattern_matches\': pattern_matches,\n \'roman_numerals_found\': roman_numerals_found\n }\n }\n \n # Save main results file\n results_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'thieme_becker_final_chronological_analysis.json\')\n with open(results_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n json.dump(final_results, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False)\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Comprehensive results saved to: {os.path.basename(results_file)}")\n print(f" File size: {os.path.getsize(results_file):,} bytes")\n \n # Save extracted text separately for easy review\n text_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'extracted_text_from_image.txt\')\n with open(text_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"EXTRACTED TEXT FROM THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\'*60}\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Image: {img_filename}\\n")\n f.write(f"Extraction Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n")\n f.write(f"Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"RAW EXTRACTED TEXT:\\n")\n f.write(f"{\'-\'*40}\\n")\n f.write(extracted_text)\n f.write(f"\\n{\'-\'*40}\\n")\n \n if found_years:\n f.write(f"\\nCHRONOLOGICAL YEARS FOUND: {sorted(list(found_years))}\\n")\n f.write(f"LATEST YEAR: {latest_year}\\n")\n else:\n f.write(f"\\nNo chronological years found.\\n")\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Extracted text saved to: {os.path.basename(text_file)}")\n \n # Create summary report\n summary_file = os.path.join(workspace_dir, \'final_analysis_summary.txt\')\n with open(summary_file, \'w\', encoding=\'utf-8\') as f:\n f.write(f"THIEME-BECKER LEXICON IMAGE - CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS SUMMARY\\n")\n f.write(f"={\'=\'*70}\\n\\n")\n f.write(f"Analysis Date: {datetime.now().strftime(\'%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S\')}\\n")\n f.write(f"Source: Carl Nebel Wikipedia first citation reference\\n")\n f.write(f"Target URL: http://web.archive.org/web/20230306063201/https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thieme-Becker\\n")\n f.write(f"Image Analyzed: {img_filename}\\n")\n f.write(f"Image Dimensions: {content_image[\'width\']} x {content_image[\'height\']}\\n")\n f.write(f"OCR Text Length: {len(extracted_text)} characters\\n\\n")\n \n if found_years:\n f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS:\\n")\n f.write(f"- Years found: {sorted(list(found_years))}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Latest year: {latest_year}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Earliest year: {min(found_years)}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Total years: {len(found_years)}\\n\\n")\n \n f.write(f"LATEST YEAR ({latest_year}) DETAILS:\\n")\n latest_matches = [m for m in pattern_matches if m[\'year\'] == latest_year]\n for match in latest_matches:\n f.write(f"- Pattern: {match[\'pattern\']}\\n")\n f.write(f"- Context: \'{match[\'context\']}\'\\n")\n f.write(f"- Position: {match[\'position\']}\\n\\n")\n else:\n f.write(f"CHRONOLOGICAL FINDINGS: No years found\\n")\n \n print(f"‚úÖ Summary report saved to: {os.path.basename(summary_file)}")\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No text extracted from image (OCR returned empty result)")\n latest_year = None\n \n except ImportError:\n print(f"‚ùå OCR client not available - gradio_client not installed")\n print(f"Cannot proceed with text extraction from image")\n latest_year = None\n \n except Exception as ocr_error:\n print(f"‚ùå OCR analysis failed: {str(ocr_error)}")\n latest_year = None\n \n else:\n print(f"‚ùå Failed to download image: HTTP {img_response.status_code}")\n print(f"Response headers: {dict(img_response.headers)}")\n latest_year = None\n \nexcept Exception as e:\n print(f"‚ùå Error processing image: {str(e)}")\n latest_year = None\n\nprint(f"\\n" + "="*80)\nprint(f"THIEME-BECKER IMAGE CHRONOLOGICAL ANALYSIS COMPLETE")\nprint(f"="*80)\n\nif \'latest_year\' in locals() and latest_year:\n print(f"üéØ SUCCESS: Latest chronological year found in image: {latest_year}")\n print(f"üìç This is the answer to the PLAN requirement")\nelse:\n print(f"‚ö†Ô∏è No chronological years found or analysis failed")\n\nprint(f"\\nüìÅ All data saved to workspace: {workspace_dir}")\nprint(f"‚úÖ Thieme-Becker image chronological analysis completed!")',
"description": "Completing the interrupted Thieme-Becker image analysis by resuming from where the previous execution stopped. This code: (1) Checks the workspace structure and uses the most recent workspace directory, (2) Loads the saved HTML file or re-downloads if needed, (3) Identifies the specific content image (the Thieme-Becker lexicon page with Perwanger entry, 220x357 pixels), (4) Downloads the content image with proper URL handling for archived content, (5) Uses OCR (Hugging Face Tesseract-OCR) to extract all visible text from the image, (6) Applies comprehensive regex patterns to search for chronological years in various formats (1000-2100 range), including date formats, year ranges, and Roman numerals, (7) Identifies the latest (most recent) chronological year found in the image text, (8) Saves comprehensive results including the extracted text, all found years, pattern matches, and the final answer. thieme_becker_image_analysis.json (491 bytes)\nFound existing HTML file: workspace_0e9e85b8-52b9-4de4-b402-5f635ab9631f/thieme_becker_archived_page.html (181,560 bytes)\nPage title: Thieme-Becker ‚Äì Wikipedia\nMain content area identified: div\n\n=== IDENTIFYING THE CONTENT IMAGE ===\nFound 3 total images on the page\n\nImage 1:\n Source: //web.archive.org/web/20230307222308im_/https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c5/Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg/220px-Perwanger%2C_Christoph_%28aus_Ulrich_Thieme%2C_Felix_Becker%2C_Allgemeines_Lexikon_der_Bildenden_K%C3%BCnstler_von_der_Antike_bis_zur_Gegenwart%2C_S._460%29.jpg\n Classes: ['thumbimage']\n Dimensions: 220 x 357\n ‚úÖ IDENTIFIED AS CONTENT IMAGE -
